title: Air Live Jubilee Hills
address: Road No. 36, Above Jaguar Showroom, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034, India
description: Swanky modern bar with global cooking. This contemporary spot features a range of international dishes alongside a full bar with cocktails.
user_review: "Good food and live music is too good during the weekends."

reviews_content.text:
I’m giving a 0-star rating to the cheese pineapple cherry item on the menu—honestly, it’s a miss and I strongly recommend Airlive remove it.

On the bright side, the onion rings are a must-try, absolutely the best part of the order! Everything else was decent, nothing standout but okay. The vibe here is 💯, totally on point and a great experience overall.

The Ambience is absolute scintillating. The are many signature appetizers available mainly “LOTUS STEM SWEET”. I have never tasted it before and I would recommend must try it. I would scale service 5 out of 5. Mojitos are must try here. Overall experience is 4.5 out of 5. Love to explore this place oncemore.
AirLive offers a vibrant rooftop ambiance, perfect for evenings. The live music enhances the experience, and the food is delicious with a good variety. Great spot for chilling with friends or family!

Qe went in the afternoon time during the lunch...it's a good place for having a couple of beers with a lunch with decent prices because we have happy hours from 12 pm to 6 pm with 50% off on the bill...

Post 7pm, if anyone wanted to go, then the entry fees in 2K per person, which is redeemable.

Have fun, guys ✨️

Service is slow (Note this point)
Food taste is above avg, and quantity is avg per serving

If you're looking for the perfect night out, this is the place to be. The live music is on another level—whether it's a local band or a touring act, every performance is electric and gets the whole crowd moving. The sound quality is spot-on, and the vibe is unbeatable.

But what really sets this club apart is the staff. From the moment you walk in, you're treated like a VIP. The bartenders are fast, friendly, and know how to mix a great drink. Security and floor staff are professional and always present without being intrusive. You can tell they genuinely care about making your night amazing.

Whether you're out for a date, celebrating with friends, or just need to let loose, this club delivers every time. Highly recommended for anyone who loves great music, great energy, and top-tier service.

Smoking in the dining area is not at all acceptable
Smoking area was there but the staff/management was not strict about it.

AC was switched off
Total bill was 4000 and I hardly spent for 35min
Worst experience inside a restobar/night club
I happened to visit this place with friends. The food is good and the ambience wonderful! The bar menu has a lot of options to choose from. Good music with Good vibes ,will want to visit again.

One of the finest places for live music in the heart of Hyderabad. This place is always overcrowded on weekends, and specially during peak hours. Two best things about the pub - live music: very vibrant and refreshing new brands every week. And the second things is the choice of drinks. They have a decent spread, with cocktails the best among them.

Over priced place, and would need atleast 4 people to join for a table. Horrible, that you have to stand for whole night if its just 1 or 2 of you go here. Additional coupons or charges at the entrance, 1000 INR per person (mind you even you book online and with no guarantee of a seat inside).

Otherwise its a good vibe and good place for a live music.

This was by far the worst experience I've ever had at any establishment. The staff displayed a complete lack of professionalism and courtesy, with no regard for customer service. I recently visited the place with a friend, and from the moment we arrived, the experience was frustrating.

There was no one available to greet or assist us. We had to find our own table, only to be told much later that the spot was reserved and we needed to move. After relocating to another table as suggested by the staff, we were once again asked to shift because, apparently, that table was also reserved. The lack of coordination among the staff was appalling.

What made the situation even more unacceptable was the aggressive attitude of the management. If you express even the slightest disagreement or hesitation, their immediate response is to call in bouncers rather than resolve the issue calmly and respectfully. This behavior is both intimidating and unprofessional.

Additionally, they imposed a cover charge before allowing entry, which would have been understandable had the service and experience justified it—but it clearly did not. Overall, it was a complete waste of time and money. I strongly advise others to avoid this place, as it lacks both customer care and basic decency.

In December 2024, my office team and I visited this pub. It’s a great place with reasonable packages, good food, and excellent service. Although there’s no dance floor, they have nice live singing. However, the bathrooms weren’t well-maintained. Parking is available.

We went there for a weekend party. Entered the place around 9pm and it was already full. At the entance they informed us that we would have seats near bar counter but when we went there , there was no place. When asked the managers they are giving us some bench to stand near it. It look awkward for me that they do over booking than their capacity.

If capacity is 200, its fair to have 210 guests but here they are allowing more than 300 or 400 guests and they charge everyone equally and good amount.

Please take bookings only upto your capacity and DO NOT overbook and give the guests the worst ever environment / atmosphere / ambience
Food was ok.....but the atmosphere around too gud ....gud vibes....for dance and party....

I visited Airlive recently and had a fantastic time. The place has a stylish, upbeat vibe with a good mix of indoor and rooftop seating—ideal whether you're out with friends or just unwinding after a long day.

What made the night special was the live band. They performed a mix of Bollywood retro hits, 90s favorites, and popular new songs, creating the perfect musical backdrop. It wasn’t just entertainment—it added soul to the whole experience.

The service was smooth and the staff was attentive without being pushy.

Prices are slightly on the higher side, but the live music, lively atmosphere, and overall experience make it worth it.

If you're in the mood for good music, chill vibes, and a place that feels alive, Airlive should be on your list.

The restaurant is nothing out of the ordinary, but it checks all the boxes: good food, a casual ambience, and excellent service. If you are looking for a run-of-the-mill place to enjoy food and drinks, this is a very good option. The staff here are friendly and courteous. The place is not very crowded, so it is quite relaxed than the competitors along the street. The food is copacetic, but management should work on the bar menu.

The place was filled with smoke. Pasta was dry and the rest of the food items that we've ordered was also not good. The waiters didn't gave us the desired table even after asking multiple times. The bouncer didn't allowed us to stand in front for images/videos and always nudged us to go away. The performance lasted for max. 30 minutes while we were there for around 2-3 hours. Overall not a good experience, won't recommend and visit again.

The best place to hangout with your colleagues after a hectic week. Bollywood lovers will love it here cause the live music is so amazing. Well I will prefer the jubilee hills branch more than the Madhapur one, all because of the ambience. It has rooftop whereas the Madhapur one is kind of enclosed.  But the vibe at both the places are incomparable. Moreover, the food here is nice and okay.

I visited the place for live music and loved the show. The food is also good, just had some starters and they were good and authentic. Entry is 1000 with full cover you can buy food with the entry coupon you got.

I am very much disappointed with the behaviour of staff (bouncers) and I am about complaint a report to local police. The bouncers have taken my valet parking token and they asked me to wait outside the gate. Surprisingly they have given my new Tata Curvv EV to a stranger and they went away with my car. After sometime they returned to the restaurant and they realised that it was not their car and handed over it to me. In this gap when we asked the person who took my valet parking token, he upfront denied by saying we are not responsible. I urge the senior management of Air live to please go through the CC footage of 8th June, Sunday night to understand more about our situation. This is really very bad experience and I will never ever visit this place again in future.

Everything was perfect. Live performance was electric, full of energy and vibrant, made the crowd go nuts..food was enjoyable but everything is expensive here we booked 40% off coupons on Zomato but they charged 1000 per person as minimum spend to enter the place on which this coupon was not applicable. We were 4 and gave 4000 to enter. Since our bill was 6500, we got the 40% off on remaining 2500 bill.
But this a go to place if you are looking for a perfect music night to enjoy and cherish...!

Great place to hang out with friends! The food was delicious, the service was quick, and the atmosphere was lively with great music. Perfect for a weekend night out. Ample parking space and good vegetarian options available. Highly recommend!

Very bad experience. They couldn't sing a single telugu song being in Hyderabad. Very sad. I will never visit again. Prices are very high. Cheap service. Better change it to air dead. Thu... Worst pub. Being in Hyderabad asked for telugu song and the bouncers took me out..

Good ambience with decent food. Had huge range of varieties in the menu covering many cuisines. Nachos were a bit disappointing as they were too thick to be called nachos. Melon broth would easily be the best mocktail in the menu. Special mention would be their Alfredo Pasta because it tasted so good. Rest of the items were adequate. Recommended to visit during happy hours.
Great ambience and good food. Don't get any cocktails though, beer should be good. Cocktails seem to be made with cheap liquor and should be avoided.

If you’re planning to have dinner with friends or family sitting at a ‘normal’ table, I would recommend going before sunset or just during weekdays. We visited after 6:30 on a Saturday and the usual tables were apparently reserved for bigger groups and specific members. The only options were high stooled tables and lounge couches. That said - the food was good - came out quick enough and was seasoned well. The live music was good too. It does get really smokey after a point though (as indoor smoking is allowed at this place).
Food was great even though the wait time was significant and service was fine, I saw rat near corner the sofa maintenance. They need to upgrade their furniture and improve the maintenance

The pub has a live band which is average. The ambience is good. The staff are friendly and serve fast. The starters are only good do not go for the main course. Visit in early timings cause I personally Dunn want to wait when I reach to a pub for a seat. The crowd is like vibe after lockdown. They should improve their beer and whiskey brands to more extent. The cost is like any other pubs in that area 36 is a road of its kind. Crispy corn chicken 65 and tikka with pizza is good. Strictly avoid place if you are not adjusted to noise area.

Staff is too stubborn, rude and arrogant.

I Just said I am not liking the table and want to sit on another table.. At this waiter said no and ask me to share a table with unknown couple. When I said no then they asked me to leave.

They could have said mam let us try.. But no they said asked me leave.

I been to Australia, Thailand clubs. .  I was never treated so bad. That too by an uneducated waiters.

And their is no manager to teach and train them manners.
Giving extra bad rating due to bad staff and money extortion practices we noticed. Absolutely disrespectful staff.

title: Stone Waters - Kitchen & Lounge
address: 5th Floor, Aruna Arcade, 1299B, Road No. 1, opposite KBR Park, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India
user_review: "nice food, great live music and superb crowd."

reviews_content.text:
Fantastic spot to hang out with friends! The lively atmosphere, delicious food, and warm hospitality made for an unforgettable experience.

The highlight was definitely the live Bollywood music, featuring iconic 90's tracks that got me grooving. The valet parking service was a bonus, ensuring a hassle-free evening.

While the food was good, I think a slight tweak in flavors would elevate it to the next level. Overall, I had an absolute blast and would definitely recommend this place!

Love this place for live music but service here sucks.

I made an advance booking…but still they were not ready to give us any of the front tables…they were giving us on the corners.

Last option they gave us was near counter but only with one chair…how is it fair…!!
Whats the point of making advance booking then…!!!

Coming to food , it was good.

Coming to live music, I requested one song, my request reached to the band member(guy in black tshirt), he wiped his face with that request which was on tissue…heights of rudeness!!!

This place is not for dates….go with friends so that you can a table in front…bit there also you won’t get enough chairs!!

We have visited this place 2year ago it was good at that time the music service and air on top of roof but yesterday me and 4 friends visited . these was a live music which was not the best it’s was playing musical games with kids the service is really bad and the quantity of food is cheap can’t eat that much although you are hungry
A service waiter was so rude with us they don’t have any common sense how to behave with guests we were at corner of the place so we came forward for like 15min for few snaps but then waiter named Suresh was behaving very unprofessional with us then we left the place we also have complete about him to the manager but there was no action has been taken
This place management should teach there staff and educat there staff how to behave with women’s and there guest we also gave Suresh this lesson wrost time at stone water ever

Pathetic service, manager and general manager lacked professionalism. There are spelling mistakes in menu, special treatment for selected people rest all have been asked to sit in a congested sofocating corner with no ac. When asked to help on increasing cooling they said this is best that they can do attitude. Rest all chairs were empty!! Also in their ad for live music it said 8pm starting but once we reached there they said it will start at 10pm! Way to fool people!

Ambience was great. Live music was a calm and beautiful add on to the atmosphere. Staff service was fine. Food was so-so. We ordered 3 vegetarian dishes- potato wedges, oriental cigar roll, caesar salad,..out of which only potato wedges was good.

The place is really awesome. With the rooftop vibe and cozy breezes it becomes perfect on windy days! And for the live music nights they always have such amazing bands performing in there. The food is good as well, but the service needs to be improved. Their staff is pretty arrogant & does not respond in one call most of the times. They sometimes ignore you intentionally so that does not give off a good impression to new people. Apart from that, no other complaints from this place, it’s a gem!

TL DR:- Stone Waters has bad food and worse service. Go to Exotica instead.

This place has gone to the drains. We used to frequently visit there till 2022 and both the food & service were awesome. One of the few places in Hyderabad that used to have authentic North Indian food. Staff were courteous and friendly. Back to 2024, we visited the place last Friday and were appalled at the complete change from our previous experiences. Firstly, if you go in as a couple (group of 2), they will not let you seat at the tables adjacent to the floor railing (from where you have the outside views and arguably the best seats in the restaurant). They will lie that these seats are reserved when actually the entire place was empty at around 8 PM. I had to argue with them and finally they gave us a corner seat which had the smallest table ever in any restaurant that I have visited. Secondly the food was horrible. The chicken starters tasted uncooked and had raw chicken smell. The dried chilli chicken was worse. Naam and butter chicken were ok ish. They will have items in the Menu but apparently some of them are not available. Like we wanted Mutton Biriyani but the staff said no. The less I tell about service the better and this really irritated me. Whenever we wanted something, we would have to shout at full volume to call the staff to take our orders or to clean our plates or to bring the menu. Multiple times they will see us waiving at them and they would simply ignore it. It is apparent that they have changed their staff (my guess is the cook also) and these people have zero training or understanding about customer service at a restaurant. Will never visit again. Attaching pics only for our proof of attendance , otherwise people might think that this is a paid review.

Good place to spend the weekend. They did have live music but it started at 10:30 and it got over at 12:30. Mostly they sang all the bollywood new,old and punjabi hit songs. No telgu songs. We really enjoyed the evening here.

Its not a big place. But a small and cosy rooftop pub. Try to get a place in fornt of the stage. Its open and you can enjoy the natural beauty. They have a huge menu to choose from for both veg and nonveg. Food was ok. They dont have draught beer. Ultra and budweiser is priced at 355.

Ambience and service was good. As there was no much crowd but decent crowd. They dont have any proper dance floor. Finding the place was a bit difficult but its not a issue. They have parking service.

I recently visited this open-space lounge, and it turned out to be one of the most decent places I've been to. I ordered both vegetarian and non-vegetarian chili starters, priced at approximately Rs. 500 per plate. It's a perfect spot to spend quality time with friends, loved ones, or anyone you want to unwind with. The ambiance is enhanced by amazing live music, making it a truly enjoyable experience.

Having visited many cafes, lounges, bars, and restaurants, I found this place to be exceptional. Although the prices are on the higher side, the location, live music, and excellent service make it worth it. Overall, I had a great time enjoying the food, drinks, and live performances. I would recommend people to visit this place.

An amazing place if you want to enjoy live music. The only problem is if you are less than a group of 4 they give you corner table which are a little suffocating. Other than that, the ambience and vibe is amazing!

Food was tasty but had slight indigestion the next day. Service was delayed by at least 25mins though there were only 3 tables occupied on a weekday(wednesday).

Atmosphere was great with live hindi songs. Cool natural breeze..!!

DJ's song selection was impeccable, seamlessly blending genres and eras to keep the dance floor electrified. The music flowed effortlessly, creating an unforgettable atmosphere that left everyone wanting more.Food was  good ,a bit disappointed in the service but overall it was a spectacular evening!

DO NOT OVERBOOK IF YOU CAN'T SERVE

These bars fail to understand sucha. Simple concept. Okay this is one of the rare live music places with no cover charge hence they have a lot of people wanting to come. The crowd is huge. On Saturday night, they remove chairs and you've to stand and eat all the time. You don't get a table despite booking a table on district. Yeah they continue taking bookings from all platforms despite being at 200% capacity utilisation. Around 11:30, the crowd is no less than Dadar station. There is just no space of dance. People are barely standing. But greed has no limit hence they keep getting more and more people in. Average food. But jeera rice was exceptional and the fourth floor tam jham restaurant which is part of the same group.

Not recommended

This was my first time here. First things first, the ambience here was really good with a great view of KBR park.

Got here with a couple of friends at 4:30 pm, probably not the best time to visit as the whole place was empty like literally we were the only people there other than the staff. Understandable as that was post lunch and pre dinner time. None of the items that need a tandoor weren't available like Naan, Chicken Tandoori etc.

The food was amazing, enjoyed all the appetizers (Oriental Cigar Rolls, Apollo Fish and Tawa Prawns), main course (Chilli Garlic Fried Rice and Chilli Chicken) and desserts (only Sizzling Brownie was available) we've ordered.

This brings me to the only disappointment, being the only people there, the staff just couldn't care less, they were just out there somewhere in their own world chatting in a group the whole time we were there. Had to literally call them multiple time to take a single order. The food took too much time to arrive as well.

Better service could've made this a 5 star experience.

A place where we can enjoy the drinks and food with a roof top view experience.  Ambience is good with music.  Rainy and winter seasons are perfect to enjoy the roof top during day time. Italian recipes and are not up to the mark if you are a spicy food lover.

The food tastes amazing with nominal prices, it's on the terrace with an amazing view of KBR park, nice and breezy. Good ambiance,. A beautiful place to take your girl for a date.
The place can accompany small parties but not more the 15-20 people. As it'll be hard to club all the tables because there are tables for 4/6 across the area.
The restaurant serves continental, italian and Indian food.
Alcohol is also served for people above 21
Happy hours is from 12-5pm ( you get 1+1 bear)
DJ is also played at night
Not air conditioning only outdoor air ventilation if I'm not wrong
The place can accommodate a maximum of 40-50 people
Nights be would a better time to come rather than in the mornings
There is no buffets.
Alcohol priced reasonably
Set in a prime location

(Reason for 3 stars)
But I must talk about the service and the waiters, they are quite unprofessional, they don't respond fast enough, they also lack good communication skills

Desserts are very limited to 3 of 4

The starters are okayish
There is no proper branding on the building which is hard to identify from the main road
The milkshakes are limited to 2-3 flavours which were made using flavoured ice cream which was not true to it's taste.
Good bands. Good food. Nice music for Bollywood. Good vibe

It was Stone Waters Anniversary night and the band just blew my mind, literally amazing. It's Zomato Gold 1+1 food place but idk why they were not having variety in beers and was a lil overrated as well. But anyway you can still go and enjoy the food n music with your friends. Make sure you make a reservation if going on weekends

This is korean pot noodles!!!! Can you imagine getting hakka noodles with mix veg gravy when you order korean pot…..the koreans will die!!! And post this imagine the unaccepting and unapologetic chef!
The serving staff is amazing, hence we let this go…..
Amazing time at stone waters. Enjoyed the Bollywood music by DIL Nawaz all the way from Punjab. He just shook the place with his mesmerising voice.

For all looking for a place with Live music, this is one one. They have different bands playing here almost every week. Ambiance wise it's rooftop and therefore can be windy sometimes. The lights are quite dim(which is great). It's a bit above average in terms of prices but the food is actually good.

I like this place for it's aesthetic setting. The choice of music bands is pretty good. They have some really good starters to eat too. I really like the red pepper chicken and malai chicken, although the barbecue chicken wings we ordered had too much sauce in it. Main course is just fine. The service is cordial.

The service or staff is pathetic, no proper response. Once I visited the place, they showed the table after multiple follow-ups and it was not clean and no chairs. The waiter had come with menu asking to place the order where I was standing next to table. The response and behaviour of the staff is not up to the mark. I have been to this place in the past but I think due to increased demand and crowd they are unable to manage well anymore.
Live music band was good. Food was ok. Veg mexican pizza was better than chicken tikka pizza . Avalanche drink was nice. Chicken bbq wings was good.

It's a roof top restaurant. You don't get the seats which have the good view if you walk in late, so better try to go early. It had live band performance when I went, the band was too good but the music was too loud that we couldn't hear our friends talk. Rest the experience and food were amazing. :-)

Stone water in jubliee hills is really amazing kitchen to enjoy the vibe with good music n food with a Serenic view from either ends of the lounge. I love the bands that come to play here as they are one of the best bands and when the food taste adds more value to the vibe its a fabulous combination.

Good for weekends get away! If you're into music, dating for couples too!
Had a team outing here!
Open space with good view!

View from this point is amazing and superb atmosphere. They check id proof before entering into. Food wad tasty and hygienic place. One thing that i think of is pricing is somewhat expencive for me. But once in a long time its ok for me.

title: Tevar - The Progressive Indian Kitchen & Bar
address: Block, Gate no. 11, SALARPURIA SATTVA ARGUS, SALARPURIA SATTVA KNOWLEDGE CITY, Shop 3, Unit 2, Hyderabad, Telangana 500081, India
user_review: "... place has live music, great ambiance and variety in taste n cuisine."

reviews_content.text: Ambience is amazing.  Food is yummy and the presentation is impressive. However it's premium so expect a hit on your wallet. Desserts are so dammnnn good. Must try.

Tevar serves some really great food with plenty of options to choose from. We went there for dinner and loved the overall ambience—calm and nicely done. It’s a good spot to visit for a relaxed meal, though it’s slightly on the expensive side. I’d recommend making a reservation in advance as it can get quite busy during peak hours.

All the other reviews are fake or they force their customer to give a good reviews.
But this place is absolute worthless.
They claim to be fine dine but don’t provide any appetisers or ambush food. They are expensive to height yet they force you to pay service charges. Plus our waiter without even asking served us water which cost ₹255/-
Food taste was basic which you can get at any average restaurant. Don’t go here just to pay hefty price for presentation and ambience.

Don't go by the reviews. It's a instagrammable place where food is pathetic in taste and hospitality is even worse. They serve stale cold food and when given feedback, refuse to accept it.  We tried all recommended dishes and ended up being extremely disappointed. Very bad experience.
Not recommended to anyone.

Very good experience for sure.
I liked all dishes but  chaat is my all time favourite 😍. All dishes are with twist of unique taste.
Place looks good too. It was not noisy. They do serve liquor. Mocktails are very good.

On a weekend evening went to check Tevar and have dinner with friends.

The place is modern indian focused both on food and ambiance. On the side with dining tables and bar it looks nice  but on the side with high tables towards the screen it looks very unimpressive and random. Definitely not like a supposedly high end luxury dining.

Service was very good, attentive and quick.

For food and drinks we tried different items, all of which tasted good, probably the highlight was the blue cheese chicken tikka.

Price is definitely on the higher end, definitely not budget friendly.

Overall we had a satisfactory experience.

Tevar used to be the most happening place when they opened. Visited them today for lunch, surprised that it’s half empty even on a Valentine’s Day lunch. The staff were courteous, food was good, portion size was decent. Then I guess it’s the cuisine that makes it difficult to justify premium pricing.

Order Aloo Tuk Tuk only if there are three or more to share, two of us couldn’t have that much Aloo. Darjeeling Jhol Momos were great.

Baingan Bhartha Duo is a nice concept. The Rotis we ordered were good. Paneer is good too. At a 25% lesser price, they will get more people.
We had an amazing experience. The mocktails and food was great, especially the non veg dishes like lamb seekh kabab, thecha chicken tikka and coconut prawn. The Pista Gulab jamu rabdi was too good.

A Must-Try Culinary Experience in Hyderabad!

From start to finish, our dining experience was nothing short of amazing! The food was exceptional, and the service by Badal Singh made it even more special—he served each dish with care and patience, adding a personal touch to our meal.

If you’re in Hyderabad, this restaurant is a must-visit! Be sure to try these incredible dishes: Deconstructed samosa, dhokla, achari paneer tikka, chilli garlic shrimps, onion chilli roti, baingan bharta, and mili juli jalfrezi. Each bite was packed with flavor and beautifully presented.

Highly recommended for an unforgettable food experience!

Tevar is an exceptional spot for a business dinner or a relaxed evening out. The food is consistently top-notch—flavorful, well-presented, and clearly made with quality ingredients. The service is equally impressive: attentive without being intrusive, and always professional.

What really sets Tevar apart is its atmosphere. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between upscale and inviting, making it ideal for both casual and formal dining. Their selection of liquor is also worth noting, with a well-curated list that pairs nicely with the menu.

Overall, Tevar delivers on all fronts—great food, excellent service, and a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended.

Food preparation and menu in terms of innovation is really good, one should definitely visit for the items. But service is really lacking. They market themselves as a fine dining place, yet don't fill glasses, don't time the courses correctly, etc.

We went for lunch here. All the food items ordered are tasty. They presented the food sp well. The dessert don't break my heart is so yummy. I would love to go as many times as possible. But the prices are a little high.

The taste seemed to have gone down when compared to my previous visits.

Coconut Prawns was over fried and very hard. Marina Beach fish fry was good.

The Mango preparation in Aamras poori was very good. However the poor were very small.

Cheese chicken rolls were okay. Butter chicken, mutton curry and Naans were good.

My experience went from super in the previous visits to good.

Great food. Pineapple mint Raita was awesome. Aloo tuk tuk could have been better. Nepali jhol momo was very good.
Another highlight was the Baingan Bharta Duo - loved it
Vikas Naik was a great host

Tevar – The Progressive Indian Kitchen & Bar, located in Hyderabad’s Sattva Knowledge City, offers a modern twist on traditional Indian cuisine. The restaurant’s chic ambiance features maroon and gold hues, intricate jharokha-style designs, and antique golden lamps, creating a sophisticated dining environment.  ￼

The menu showcases innovative takes on Indian classics, such as the Dhokla Blast topped with tangy fermented yogurt, and the Nadru Bhel, a crispy creation of fried lotus stem slices mixed with spices and chutneys. The live Pani Puri counter adds an interactive element, with chefs preparing the dish tableside.  ￼

While the culinary creativity is commendable, some patrons have noted that the prices are on the higher side, with an average cost of around ₹1,500 per person. Additionally, there have been mixed reviews regarding service efficiency and food quality.  ￼

In summary, Tevar provides a luxurious dining experience that blends contemporary and classic Indian flavors. However, potential diners should be prepared for premium pricing and may want to manage their expectations regarding service and food consistency.

Rex Thapa’s  service was super.

“We had an amazing experience thanks to Rex Thapa! They were attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu, offering excellent recommendations that enhanced our meal. The service was prompt, and they ensured we had everything we needed throughout our visit. Their professionalism and warm demeanor made our dining experience truly memorable. Highly recommend this place, and we’ll definitely be back!”

We had gone to this place for a celebration for dinner and we really liked the food and service. Ambience was also pretty nice.

We ordered few veg dishes and they were really tasty. Overall good experience. Only con was that we informed of the celebration during reservation itself, but they didn’t arrange for a cake.
Food and ambience were great! Gagan was our server and he took great care of us! The qawali night was a great night to be here. Definitely coming back 😊

Modern settings with good food (mostly Indian with a twist). Although on the costlier side.
Ambience is nice with acceptable background music on all days except Sunday, Wednesday and Fridays (live music on these days).

We have ordered.

1. Chilli garlic shrimps
2. Nimbu Mirchi Fish
3. Jama - Masjid chicken tikka
4. Kacche Ghost Ki Biriyani
5. Nalli Roganjosh
6. Shirfal Julep
7. Virgin Mojito

This place has won my heart, a huge shoutout to Prana who has assisted us with the menu and has explained about each dish that was served to us.. The food was simply delicious, all that we have ordered was recommended by the staff and it tasted amazing. The ambience is welcoming and has a very pleasant atmosphere.
The aroma of the Biriyani was amazing, Would have been much better/ tastier if the Biriyani had  more masala in it since I felt it was dry.

Must visit place with family and friends.

The drinks and food of this place is amazing . Loved the vibe of it . Service provided by Longbi was very prompt and nice .

Will definitely Be back :)

Really loved the restaurant. Modern settings, excellent service. We adore the drinks and the food was delicious (mostly modern Indian with a twist). Special shoutout to the truffle broccoli and live station pav bhaji. Service was attentive and the music was 🔥. We will definitely be back!
Good ambience and nice food. Service was little OK as one server was trying to look after multiple tables.

They have their own vibe going. Went on a Friday night .. amazing. Totally enjoyed the Qawaali and service is amazing.

In food I found options to be limited but whatever they have is good. Liked their drinks too.
Do go with the server’s recommendation.

One of the best culinary experiences in a very long time. The food is outstanding in taste and presentation. ( better than some of the Michelin star restaurants I have been to) We went there for family lunch. The service was delightful. The ambience is classy.

Our family favourite - Blush drink, Chicken Tikka Thecha. Kale Patta Chaat and black carrot halwa have surreal taste and presentation.

It was an incredible experience from start to finish. The food was just wow! Each dish was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented like a work of art.
Hats off to chef!
Special shout out to Tisso. He managed servicing well.

The welcome drink was very impressive, cinnamon tea served in a tiny cup. Good ambiance. Ordered coconut prawns as starter, it was served within few minutes (not as hot as out of the frying pan). Taste wise I would rate one ⭐️. Slightly over priced, may be due to location and ambience. It was a week day, still they have very less available tables for the walk in customers. We went there for dinner, but had to leave for other place due to taste and sitting options offered to us. To visit with prior booking is recommended.

Not at all a good experience. May not visit again.

From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with genuine warmth and professionalism. Rex went above and beyond to make our dining experience unforgettable — attentive without being intrusive, knowledgeable about the menu, and full of thoughtful recommendations that truly enhanced our meal. Every course was beautifully presented and packed with flavor, showcasing the kitchen's skill and creativity. The timing of service was flawless, and we never felt rushed. It's rare to find a place where both the food and service are this outstanding. Highly recommend — we’ll definitely be back!

title: Lé Vantage Café Bar
address: 195/A, Rd Number 13, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India
description: Stylish haunt with drinks & global fare. Airy, European-style venue with a terrace serving global cuisine alongside cocktails, wine & beer.
user_review: "Great place to be for some good food, great ambiance and music"

reviews_content.text: Le Vantage is a perfect place for causal dining with family and friends. Ambience is so well designed that you can capture all your moments in group pictures,  selfies and make it memorable. Talking about food, delicious Hummus with Pita Bread, mouth watering thin crust pizza, authentic Shorba with bread, creamy Pasta and refreshing mocktails. The staff was really quick and helpful. Overall a well spent family time with yummy food. The best part of Le Vantage, it is a pet friendly place.

Food was very good, each of the item was delicious. We Ordered :Pork Pepperoni- Very Good
Lamb Goulash with Homemade Fettuccine - Awesome
BBQ Chicken Wings- Okayish
Baklawa with Ice cream - ok
Brownie Espresso with Vanillace cream - very very good
although they are bit costly. And also, you will not get any sort of discount.Ambience was also very good

Food is reasonably priced, but the taste isn’t exactly top-notch. It’s not bad, but it’s not great either. The ambiance is really nice, though. You’ll even see dogs there, which is a great treat for dog lovers.

Been here a few times. it’s a cute, cozy spot with a really nice vibe. The ambience is always on point and the food is yum.

But this time I tried their Tiramisu and it was a letdown — not as creamy or rich as expected. Definitely not their best dessert.

Still a nice place overall, just wouldn’t recommend the Tiramisu.
This place was truly amazing, with a stunning ambiance that set the tone for a wonderful experience. The food was delicious, making it a perfect spot to relax and indulge.

Le Vantage Café is known for its exceptional ambience and is an excellent spot for a relaxing outing. The night view adds a magical touch to the overall experience, making it a perfect place to unwind.

The **Peri Peri Chicken Pizza** is a must-try, packed with flavorful spices and a perfectly balanced tangy kick. The pizza is freshly made with a crispy base and generous toppings, making it a delight for your taste buds.

The combination of delicious food and the soothing night atmosphere makes Le Vantage Café a highly recommended place to visit, especially for food lovers and those looking for a cozy dining experience.

Excellent ambience. This has both out door & indoor seating. Outdoor is more of smoking zone & Indoor is not. However, if you want to really enjoy the atmosphere, visit this at night hours, prefer out doors. It is cozy and great, pet friendly too...

Coming to food, it is just fine. Too pricy and I think, we can have good places that can offer better than this. But if price is not a concern, I think you can give it a try!

This is a great spot for casual outing. The ambience is lovely, the service is quick, and it’s fully pet-friendly—you can even take your pet inside. There’s plenty of parking. Overall, a good place to visit!

Really nice ambience and service. Food could have been better. Tenderloin was asked to be made medium rare but ended up being closer to well done. Kaaliya is an amazing host.

NB: They are not selling alcohol because of some license issue but the menu isn't updated.

Veg food option limited. But i go there just for cafe frappe and avocado sandwiches which are great. Its pet friendly and the vibe is very cool and aesthetic filled with plants.
I tried nachos and quesadillas which were below average.
Food, Service and Ambience are top notch. One of the best pet friendly Cafe with good food and vibe. We have enjoyed a lot.

The ambience of this place is the best part! We spent a beautiful evening here, there was no loud music and such beautiful ambience that we could have amazing conversations and the staff was very cooperative and we weren't disturbed at all. The food was pretty much average. And cocktails too. There weren't many options. But we had an unforgettable evening sitting and chatting. The Christmas decor and vibes are on point.

I just loved it. The pizza, the coffee, everything. There was this cute huge siberian to welcome me and he was so good letting me click his pics. The place has multiple seating options all giving a different vibe with the same theme. It's so quiet around and the service, quick and top notch. Go for it.

Recommended

One of the best cafes I've visited, in terms of ambience, very cozy interior with cute table lights, which will make your dining experience awesome. Best place if you're looking to go on a date.
I've tried their cream of broccoli soup and pesto pasta. The soup was fine, but the pasta was amazing. Will definitely visit again to try other items in their menu.
Loved the ambience!!! Me and my frnds had a great time there. Quantity of the food is really better than other cafes. Loved the pasta and strawberry milkshake. A very good place to click pictures.

This cafe offers a cozy and inviting atmosphere, making it the perfect spot to relax or catch up with friends. The coffee is rich and expertly brewed, with a variety of options for every taste—from strong espressos to smooth lattes. The pastries are freshly baked and pair wonderfully with the drinks, especially the croissants and muffins. The staff is friendly and always ready to make personalized recommendations. Whether you’re looking for a quiet corner to work or a lively place to enjoy a chat, this cafe creates the ideal environment. Highly recommend for anyone in search of great coffee and a warm vibe!

This Bar offers a charming vintage ambiance that captures the eye upon entering. With its cozy and aesthetically pleasing decor, it's an inviting spot for a casual outing. However, my experience here has been mixed.

While the ambiance is undoubtedly a highlight, I found the seating arrangements to be somewhat uncomfortable, with limited space between tables. This detracted from the overall comfort of the dining experience.

Unfortunately, my disappointment extended to the menu offerings. Despite visiting the café bar multiple times over the past few months, I failed to find dishes or drinks that truly appealed to my palate. While taste preferences vary, I found both the food and cocktails to be rather average, lacking the wow factor I had hoped for.

Additionally, the pricing at Lé Vantage Café Bar leans towards the higher end, which may not be justified by the quality of the offerings. While I wouldn't discourage others from giving it a try, especially for the ambiance alone, I do believe that the establishment could benefit from refining its menu and focusing more on customer service.

Overall, Lé Vantage Café Bar falls short of expectations, with its standout feature being the ambiance. While it may not leave you with a feeling of regret, it also fails to deliver anything truly exceptional. For me, the food and drinks were passable but didn't leave a lasting impression.

Came in here for late lunch on a Saturday. What was immediately alluring about here, is the generous amounts of spaciousness. The location, accessible easy car parking with valet (though you may not need it unless the parking lot gets full), the luxurious welcome arch and gateway which in particular makes you feel like you're transported to a different world are really good. On entering you will definitely like the variety of seating arrangements, whether be it the open area with shades, a cafe like area and then the more traditional restaurant setup on the first floor. The quality of ambience is top notch and this is really what you should come to experience when here. Come here prepared to spend more than an hour, eat at a leisurely pace, bring a book to read, etc.

Now let's about the meal experience in itself. We had chicken wings, pita bread with hummus for appetizers followed by pesto cream pasta and tofu broccoli rice Chinese Bowl. The food is more or less 4 stars for their taste, presentation and portions. The food is meant to be enjoyed a bit bland as the taste is subtle. Portions were good for 2. The wait staff were friendly though they seemed a bit understaffed even to support a modest crowd.

Our meal worked out to 1000INR per person, so you know you really paid for the ambience (which is why you should come here prepared for the experience and not the food by itself). 5 stars since I pretty much expected a very friendly ambience for a date with my loved one, and then got it here!

Le Vantage Café in Hyderabad is a chill spot to hang out with friends or just relax by yourself. The vibe is cozy, with a cool mix of modern and rustic décor that makes you feel right at home. The menu is packed with delicious options, but their coffee and pastries are definitely the stars perfectly brewed and super tasty. Whether you’re in the mood for a sweet treat or something savory, they’ve got you covered. The staff is super friendly, making the whole experience even better. If you’re looking for a laid-back spot to unwind and enjoy some good food and drinks, Le Vantage is definitely worth checking out!

A quick pick of my experience

I liked the atmosphere and ambience of the outside area, They had sitting arrangements inside the hall as well which was not much happening but can be good for any sort of date.

Their hot chocolate was one of "the best" hot chocolates I had in Hyderabad.
Onion rings were too pricey for the quantity we got.
We ordered brocolli soup and that was really good.
Service was 2.5/5 we personally felt that they are a bit rude especially the girl on the front desk.

Average person expenditure is almost around 1000 plus and depens on your count of orders.

A good place to hangout at last.

Certainly! Here's a generic restaurant review:

I recently had the pleasure of dining at a cozy little spot that left a lasting impression. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with just the right balance of elegance and comfort. The service was impeccable; the staff were attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely friendly, which enhanced the overall experience.

The food was the true highlight. Every dish was thoughtfully prepared, bursting with flavor, and beautifully presented. From the starters to the dessert, each bite was a testament to the chef’s skill and attention to detail. The menu offered a great variety, catering to different tastes and dietary preferences.

Overall, this place is a gem, perfect for a casual outing or a special occasion. It’s the kind of place that makes you look forward to your next visit. Highly recommended!

An amazing vintage cafe that I've visited for the first time. The tables, chairs and even the stairs. Everything was just perfect. Generally when the place is this aesthetic the food is not great but here even the food was delicious!
Must try:
Spinach and feta mini rolls
Caesar salad
Banoffee pie
Great place with variety of menu for food and for people who drink . And the ambience is quite good and peaceful , the outdoor is so damn good . Except for the rainy days 😅

Spacious seating, outdoor and indoor, multi-seating options makes this a good hang out place with friends and family. Excellent service, decent food range and taste makes it worthy. Though expensive, is a good experience. Restroom ambience is shady, could have been better

The ambience is great. Food was amazing. Service was awesome. The price is slightly on the higher end. Almost 1.5k per person depending on what you order , but the food was absolutely delicious so no complaints there. One issue is that smoking is allowed at tables , so that was a issue for me as people were smoking around nearby and it was a disturbance for me , but overall a good experience at the restaurant

Good ambience but food was just ok as I experienced a bit more salty.
Variety drinks are available.
Smoking and pets allowed.

This is one of my favourite and Definitely recommend this place for a date night or day. I’m simply impressed with everything from the entrance to the exit. The staff is super friendly. There is lots of greenery around which make eyes so delightful.there will be decent crowd on the weekends. The food is just mamma Mia specially the pizzas and I love there fries burger and mocktails.

A very cosy place. Great Ambience. I went here for dinner with my friends. Had a great time. Some of the dishes were really good.
We tried:
1. Chicken popcorn
2. Chilli chicken wings
3. Nasi goreng
4. Hummus with pita
5. Chicken hot and spicy burger
6. Fish and chips
7. Banoffe pie

I didn't like the fish and chips much but the rest of the dishes were good. The burger was really tasty and hot.
A very good place for a good romantic dinner. A little pricey of course. But if you go in a bunch, it would be reasonable.

title: Tabula Rasa (Jubilee hills)
address: 624-B, Rd Number 35, Guttala_Begumpet, Kavuri Hills, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India
description: Stylish multi-cuisine diner & bar. A low-lit outdoor space gives this multi-cuisine bar & restaurant a trendy vibe for food or drinks.
user_review: "Wonderful place with live band,good food and lively atmosphere"

reviews_content.text: Nice ambiance. Great way to watch sports. Not stag friendly. Helpful staff. Unpredictable music, volume is up and down for no reason. Performers just were rehearsing at the expense of customers pleasure until now. My first round itself was 2k plus.

Amazing food
The vibe we get here from live music is literally like a concert.
The best place to spend with friends

The signature cocktails that I've tried were very average for the price and they like to keep this place very dark that you may trip, using a low light would not kill the ambience. The entrance bouncer gave me a strange unwelcoming vibe. Not rating the food because I didn't try it!

Na personal experience was amazing
Must visit place ani chpachu
Drinks and food everything they serves was delicious
Chill out with frnds nd family I blindly recommend it 🤤

Perfect place for celebrations with live band. A lovely atmosphere with nice live band playing ok decent sound. Food was good and freshly prepared. The service was below average as the staff looks so low, especially the bar staff with huge attitude.
Besides everything, experience was good 👍🏻

It's a low-lit outdoor space with good ambience and drinks menu! The food and service could be better I felt. They also have Live Music and host bands which is a big plus if you just wanna de-stress and vibe!
You'll have a lot of Non-veg food options to choose from, Veg however is comparatively limited.

Please Note: Reservations required!

There is live band performing on the day we went. This is the first time me visiting there so here's some info from my experience. You have to pay 3k for 2 people at the entrance. You will be given 2k voucher for it and have to spend it inside.
There aren't many options for food and the available ones are not that great.
Place is under lit to maintain the ambiance.
Staff are helpful, bands performance was good. The area was a dead end so there isnt any traffic, you can take your time to leave.

Recently visited this restobar and was impressed by its low-light ambiance, which created a relaxed and intimate setting. The vibe was fantastic, with people enjoying themselves and a welcoming atmosphere. The food was good, adding to the overall enjoyable experience. The highlight of the evening was the excellent live music by the Aikam band, which truly elevated the night. Highly recommended for a memorable evening out!

Tabula Rasa is a beautiful hangout spot, offering a great vibe and live music. The band Varnam, in particular, impressed during my visit. While the drinks were a bit pricey, the food was decent. I recommend this place, especially when there are good bands performing. Ample parking, including valet service, and the open-sky roof contribute to a pleasant experience.

Went here on a Friday evening with a group of friends. We reserved a table on the day and weren't able to get good seats to view the band varnam that was playing that day. The staff is really accommodative and got us seats up. The sound systems are top notch and gives you a true concert experience.
The food and drinks are very pricey as expected, Valet parking is available and it takes a long wait at closing hours to get your car or hire a driver.

It's a very very small and congested space. We went there to watch a friend's band.

The ambience of course was a disappointment.

Food was good and tummy filling. We ordered just two dishes as we weren't sure we would have stayed long.

Service was decent too. People were around for you to call them for assistance.

Wouldn't go back to this branch maybe.

This place has the best live performance in the city. Food is quite amazing.
Overall ambience gives a lovely vibe. Slightly older age profile on a Monday evening.
Beer is quite expensive and I didn't find my favourite Kingfisher here.

This place has a great vibe. The atmosphere was electric when I visited this place last week.
I have been to many bars where they have live music but damn, this was THE best live music. The band that was performing was brilliant and the performance was top notch.
Paisa vasool show. We loved it.

Coming to the food, it was good... i didn't find anything special for the price they are charging. We tried some starters and beers. Food was good but the beer was NOT chilled. So there's a scope of improvement I felt.
Otherwise a perfect place to go with friends and buddies.

Decent and pretty place with good live music and DJ. The ambiance is really good and the taste of the food is really good . The pricing is usually high but, compared to other pubs, it is okay, and the staff here give you a table according to your dressing style and group, and the seating is really good, only when you get a table in the middle. Corner seating is not really good. For a group of 5, you usually need to spend 10k~

Best Place for Live Music Took 3k for couple when went inside they all seats are booked and Gave Seats at bar counter which was very uncomfortable.. they should have said it earlier...food was ok.has Crispy fried chicken, veg cheese cutlets ..Long iced Tea  Fruit punch and Manga muss ...Taste was good.Service was ok. beautiful ambience Serene outdoor and Cozy Indoors..Prices are little high..valet Parking available..

The service is not as good as expected.  The waiter was standing next to me most of the time just like he's one among Our table, which is irritating.
The food taste is worsening.. Something like roadside food taste.
The band that comes are good but they repeat most of the songs.
The bouncers at entry are like harsh.
They don't even give normal water on request, you must buy water bottle  pure business..

Not worth visiting if you have high expectations of food and service

Tabula Rasa – Where Music Meets Mood in Jubilee Hills

Weekend evenings at Tabula Rasa hit the right note, quite literally. We had the pleasure of catching a soulful live set by the band Raag, whose regional tunes had the crowd swaying, singing along, and soaking in the vibe.

The ambiance was relaxed yet vibrant, making it a perfect setting for an unwinding night. The food complemented the mood just right, especially the Avakai Chicken Tikka, which packed a punch of flavor and stood out as a must-try.

If you're in the mood for good music, good food, and an even better vibe, Tabula Rasa checks all the boxes.
New year, same faves! Enjoying my favorite beer and delicious food at my favorite go-to spot!

It is one of the current booming bars in Hyderabad. It’s uniqueness holds in the open air restaurant and bar idea. We Hyderabadi’s are kinda bored with rooftops now and so this can be interesting if you wanna get some fresh air while you socialise. On a rainy day, ofcourse, as you would expect, the roof is on. The place is perfect and easily accessible. The ambience is decent enough. The food is good if you enjoy spicy stuff. Prices are not very high. There are quite nice music bands during the weekend. The best part is, the singers here sing in most south indian languages like telugu, Tamil, Malayalam. The place is mostly crowded. Specially during the weekends, you can’t find a table without prior reservations. What I dint like, is the long waiting times for the order to arrive. The staff and the ordering system is not very organised.
Awesome experience. Live music by Moksha & team is fabulous..... Must visit... But a little higher on your purse😂

The atmosphere was lively and fun, and the Varnam band was amazing. The food was also delicious, with a wide variety of options to choose from. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely recommend Tabula Rasa to anyone looking for a fun night out!

The ambience is great at the night. Tabula Rasa indeed means trying out something new and this place proves it with the live music it has. The prices are a bit high. Food is good. Great to hang out with friends. The place is a bit small, not so many tables. Good to organise events.

Been here with a friend of mine. The ambience was decent but there were too many flies which was a major let down. The service was good though.
Coming to the food we had Amritsari fish tikka which was good but it has too much of dhaniya flavour. We also had chicken tikka masala with paratha and butter chicken with jeera rice which were amazingly good.
Overall it was a decent experience except for the flies. I would rate this place as
Food - 4/5
Service - 4/5
Ambience - 3/5

Hmmm its was just not a night to be.. if you do not understand telugu then DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE. The singer didn't or couldn't sing any hindi or english numbers. Though credit to him, he had a good voice and tone, whilst others were quite high on the music it was a total waste of time for us

On a weekend pre-booking is recommended, valet parking available and the service is prompt, in fact very quick as if in a rush to feed you. Ambience was good, food was okaish and very pricey. The mocktails were alright.

Could have spent the evening at home watching Netflix instead...
Recently visited tabula Rasa. Not up to the expectations. No proper sitting arrangement very congested. Menu was not as shown in website. Apart from that Food and music was quite good

3 stars for tiny space, poor lighting and 4 stars for food, but 5 stars for the band. No entry fee, cover charge (1500 per person if you go as a couple, 4000 for stags) or reservation needed on Mondays. El taxidi band was impressive. Would go again just for the live Telugu music bands here.

Visited this place after a lot of recommendations from my friends expecting good vibes/hygiene/food. But to my surprise it was a real bad experience. No ambience, poor food quality and above all darkness to hide the ills. Attaching a video where a cockroach reached right next to my plate, showing the standards of hygiene at Tabula Rasa.

Small congested place. The live band was extremely loud. We literally couldn't hear the other talk sitting right next to each other. Drinks were OK. Food was good. Cost wise it's definitely on the higher side, we spent nearly 20k for 7 drinks and 5 starters. Personally, I'll skip it next time.

title: Motown Stories Cafe
address: C8CQ+VF2, Kapil Towers, Opposite to ICICI Bank Nanakram Guda, ISB Rd, Financial District, Gachibowli, Hyderabad, Telangana 500008, India
description: Hip driving-themed spot for cafe fare. Snacks & drinks offered in a rugged driving-themed cafe with graffiti & quirky curios.

reviews_content.text: The first thing that attracts you here is a wide variety of top notch bikes, cars And yes, you could actually drive them by renting them out.This place is photogenic and has amazing biking vibes.The best thing which makes it different from other theme based cafes is the taste of food they maintain.The whole place has that Iron smell since all beams and roofs are made of metal. There are high chairs kept. It has two seating areas. One on the ground and another on the first floor.Also regarding the price point, I feel that the quality is too great to worry about the price.Best of all, this cafe stays open even after midnight. Great music with great food and coffee.
Incredible experience esp for car/bike enthusiasts- motown theme and the in-cafe vibe was just on point! They have a line-up of Harley, Porsche, Benz etc- feast to the eyes and otherwise food decent.

Stepping into Motown feels like entering a mini museum dedicated to quirky roadside adventures.

I ordered a chocolate croissant, an iced latte, and a hot cappuccino. The chocolate croissant was divine—crispy on the outside with just the right amount of gooey chocolate inside. The iced latte was perfectly balanced, not too sweet, with a smooth, robust coffee flavor. The hot cappuccino was a comforting classic, with creamy froth and a rich espresso base that warmed me up instantly.

It’s a must-visit for coffee lovers and anyone seeking a unique hangout spot.
Wow what range of coffee. Should try mushroom coffee. The food is veg and are very good. Korean buns were good. Desert tiramisu was good. Must visit for coffee lovers.

A Must visit place for a motor enthusiast as the cafe's decor is something beautiful to adore.
Still my go to midnight cafe especially during cold winters, I come and try the espresso pods with milk every-time because they have endless varieties of it. My favourite being the Hazelnut and Caramel Coffee till now.
They also display amazing supercars and super-bikes which are available for rental services.
This is my favorite cafe. I hang out with my friend here every month on weekends, and I love the coffee, especially the affogato. The service is always excellent. I really appreciate it.

The atmosphere here is really good.
If you are a guy interested in cars bikes would like nice pics and enquire about rentals- go here.
If you are looking for good coffee - skip this place.

The food is below average.
I ordered a blueberry muffin, Irish coffee and cafe caramel.
Now both the coffees looked the same and had the same average taste.

I didn't like the fact that there is no QR code menu scanning at the tables.
Staff has a very non welcoming attitude and definitely not interested to give you quality coffee.
Definitely very unique ambiance! But the food falls short of what one would hope for. The pepper mushroom soup was so subtle that i thought it was just hot water with some lemon.

Had a cup of coffee and croissant at this place. Taste was Ok. This place is photogenic and has amazing biking vibes. Crowd was awesome and we enjoyed our visit. Main attraction is the set up here. Recommended for evening coffee treat.

This cafe is beautifully decorated with antique bikes and car, you will get a vintage vibe with variety of coffee options. I really like the ambience and snacks as well. Must try chilly cheese toast, chocolate croissant 🥐.

Different ambience
Exotic cars and garage based interiors
The best thing which makes it different from other theme based cafes is the taste of food they maintain.
Affordable and economical pricing
Hazelnut frappe 5/5
Blueberry thickshake 5/5
Chilli Garlic Bread 4/5
Veg Exotic Pizza 4.5/5

It is an excellent Retro Club styled cafe. All the decor with a simple and garage-based theme gives it a unique look on the whole. When it comes to the vibe, music, atmosphere, and self-service make the cafe too good to stay and chill with friends for a longer time than usual. Food and Beverages are the best at this place since everything is served all fresh and clean. Brownies taste really great and are a perfect combo to order with any hot beverage. All the other desserts like Cake slices, Pies, Cheesecake, and Muffins are available along with many savory items such as Sandwiches, Burgers, and Pizzas. This place is a must visit cafe in Hyderabad.

It's a great place for automobile enthusiasts. The place has a lively vibe to it theri array of different types of coffees and teas with an assortment of snacks to go along with your beverage is great. I find myself most of the weekends chilling over at Driven Cafe with my buddies. The interior has a rustic steam punk look to it. The service is quick even though it's a self serve arrangement.

Nice Ambience. Love the superbikes kept inside. Food is just on par with Starbucks. The whole place has that Iron smell since all beams and roofs are made of metal. There are high chairs kept. It has two seating areas. One on the ground and another on the first floor. Do visit for some fun times.

I am so much in love with this cafe. 😍
After a long time I have wanted to drink coffee regularly. They serve the best coffee in the neighborhood, also the best ambience for bike lovers. You can even rent bikes from here. And let me tell you the bikes are great.
Also regarding the price point, I feel that the quality is too great to worry about the price.
Best of all, this cafe stays open even after midnight. Great music with great food and coffee.

I visit every Saturday. Trust me normally I will get bored of going someplace so frequently but this place is too amazing.

The first thing that attracts you here is a wide variety of top notch bikes, cars And yes, you could actually drive them by renting them out. The theme of the cafe is so vibrant and lifting spirits that you wouldn't mind to while away time and chat away to glory with your gang. A good variety of Tea & Coffee is served. Prices are not too high unlike similar themed Cafes. Overall a cool experience with a will to definitely wanna go again.

First of all this is the worst cafe in this area..please don't waste your time money and mood..I will just not recommend it..

1. Food is just bad..this is my worst experience about food in any cafe..I couldn't understand why people are recommending this cafe..and it's a veg cafe😳...I should give minus rating to them but there is no option at all..
We ordered:
✓Cheese chilli toast (0/5)
✓Paneer tikka sandwich (0/5)
✓Coffee mocha (1/5)
✓Cappuccino (1/5)
✓ Tripple chocolate cake (0/5)
I won't recommend to waste your money on their food..plating is also bad

2. Service is too poor..they are not cleaning tables at all..they don't have pepper powder to sprinkle also..they are just bad..they have given automatic token dispenser to customer but it was ringing after the food we have took from them..so so bad experience..

3.we didn't't like the ambience also..if u want to sit outside that is also a bad decision..so don't go.. Highly not recommend 👎💀

The aesthetic is really one of a kind.
We tried mocha latte and capachino. Mocha latte is good.
The service was fast.

Awesome cafe. Worth visiting. The best thing about the place is the taste of coffee they serve. Any sort of coffee you choose, they will provide you the best taste they can. Another good thing is that the cafe is open 24*7, so you can visit the place any time. The quantity of the coffee provided is more than enough. Personally, i am never able to finish even the regular coffee. The snacks provided are good for short bites.  Have been to this  place several times and  will surely recommend it. The ambience  of the place is strongly built on bike and car theme. You can even hire expensive cars & bikes from this place. Must visit for quick bites.

This place resembles same like workshop.I enjoyed it, everything is expensive but if you are looking to watch sports bikes and cars you can find it here. They have various cars from different companies and I found bikes too like Ducati etc. Overall experience was good how ever we could only had a coffee there ambiance is so perfectly build like they have various mechanics tools.

Amazing place, lot of cool rides to look and pick from. The seating is very modernist. Make no mistake, it IS a biker’s cafe. It screams like one and does well.

I had the coffee and it was good, and served hot.. unlike those yippie joints where it’s lukewarm. The way it should be. Staff is warm and friendly.

There are plenty of bakery options to choose from, both vegetarian and non-vegetarian. The prices are also fairly reasonable.

Parking is tricky as you may need to park in basement. I was lucky to get slot outside.

Must visit if you like bikes, fast cars. A few cycles are kept on display too but I am a cyclist myself and they were ok sort.

It certainly is a unique experience and must visit spot.

A cafe for bike and car enthusiasts. The cafe is based on a garage like theme with high end cycles and bikes placed inside it. You can also rent racing bikes here at a per hour cost. Regarding the drinks, I would say it's perfect. A must visit cafe for sports bikes and car enthusiasts.

Have always heard about Driven Cafe a lot but didn’t liked it on person. Mught the quality has been decreased.

Didn’t find the snacks worthy of price. Ordered chilli chesse toast - wasn’t fresh, not ovened properly. Presentation was more like a local shop.
Even after asking coffee in non disposable cups we were served in paper cups. One coffee had a hair strand and we had to ask them a lot to change it.
Staff is non cooperative.

Even the vibe was not upto the status.

I would suggest Driven Cafe to maintain and work on the food and ambience quality and hygiene.

located inside Kapil tower has enough parking space. This rustic themed cafe is styled like garages...
Ordered paneer sandwich, palak corn sandwich, cold coffee n banana walnut cake.

I like the place .. place is Pretty cool . If you are biker or you like bikes don’t don’t have like me then you should come here and click with bike 😅😅😍 i to love this concept… you definitely hang out here .. it’s very cool dude type place .. I came alone 🥲. If you have company you can come with them and enjoy the coffee and  menu 😊

A quirky retro cafe with quirky wall art, murals, and bikes. It is a bit sad that they had to shut off the first floor for business. Also, a little effort for the upkeep of the place can be shown as the cafe has the potential to attract more crowd. The food that we ordered was amazing especially the banana muffin and the cold coffees. Hope it continues to remain charming and artsy.

Good place to hangout with friends during office hours. Great ambience and good drinks(coffee and shakes ) available here.
The bikes and cars displayed outside the cafe and also the posters and the design is a visual treat.

One of the best places in the city that I know of.

I would highly recommend trying the dessert brownie ( please do ask them to heat it for longer time) and then dive in right at it.

Ive been here on multiple occassions, and tried the following

1 dessert brownie - best
2 raspberry lemonade- I like raspberry and liked it as well
3 cinnamon roll- was alright
4 peanut butter brownie ( worth it for PB lovers)

Head over, give this place it's due love

title: Makobrew Vegetarian Restaurant & Cafe | Jubilee Hills
address: Sri Peddamma Thalli Temple, Rd Number 44, CBI Colony, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India

reviews_content.text: Absolutely smitten by the place with both indoor and outdoor seating options... must visit for their speciality coffee and lip smacking food!The cozy ambiance with soft lighting and comfortable seating made it a perfect spot to unwind. The staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive, adding to the overall pleasant experience. There’s a bunch of different coffee options to choose from. Whether you’re a fan of strong espresso or prefer a slow-brewed pour-over, they’ve got you covered. They don’t just do great coffee; their selection of starters is fantastic! Additionally, they offer valet parking, which adds to the convenience. Overall, it's a wonderful place to enjoy...

The service is brilliant. The staff were so friendly, helpful and attentive.

The ambience is so disappointing.. especially in this climate. Outdoor sitting is not preferred in this climate. I came to attend a workshop and I hated the ambience because of the climate.

I tried their sonic cold brew and mozzarella carrozza. The mozzarella carrozza was really good.. the pomodoro sauce is delicious with it. The sonic cold brew was not so good. The espresso is way too strong and the citrus flavour is mentioned sweet in the menu.. but it isn't really sweet.. I was disappointed.

Its an interesting cafe near Peddamma Thalli Temple at Jubilee Hills. Known for pure veg, vegan and Jain menu. You will find a variety of options in the menu to try out.

What I really liked is the coffee menu. Damn so cool is what I would say. We tried berry's coffee tail (which is their signature cold coffee) and Yung Yang (a Hong kong special coffee which is a blend of tea, coffee over condensed milk). Very different from all the fancy coffee cafes in Hyderabad. This was a surprise for me!

Coming to food, its okay I wouldn't say something great but good overall. Its a place good for kids and family for a lazy dinner or lunch. Ambience is good too. Easy going and nothing fancy here. Just a simple but efficient sitting area (bright in the day and shiny at night).

Lacks good dessert options. I must say good for health conscious diners😀

Service is quick and friendly. Enough space to park the car. So wouldn't be an issue. Overall a good place to dine or go out for a coffee at Jubilee Hills.
Just had the best Nutella hot chocolate ever 🔥 The consistency was spot on—perfectly balanced, not too thick or too thin. The menu may be on the pricier side, but every penny feels totally worth it.
A coffee outing with a friend. The vibe is up to the mark at the cafe, and the service can be improved. Loved the coffee we ordered. Tried their Latte and Irish coffee.

Too many mosquitos, other than that food was decent, service was on point. I recommend hazelnut cold coffee, veg falafel and their corn cheese balls. Overall a decent place to visit if you are in or near peddamma gudi

The ambiance was cozy and inviting, perfect for a relaxed meal.
The Pasta with Alfredo sauce was creamy perfection, Megistic mashroom was hitting the taste buds, the Sonic Cold Brew was refreshingly smooth, lastly we had Paneer Biryani, was flavorful and aromatic. Highly recommended for vegetarians.

Went with friends for some coffee at Makobrew.

We had Vanilla Tonic Espresso, Flat White, Vanilla Cream Latte and some others. The coffee was average overall, Vanilla Tonic Espresso probably the best.

Service was ok.

Ambiance was so and so, the place could definitely be better maintained.

Average experience, room from improvement.

My photo doesn’t do justice to the place because food was sooo good that I remembered to take a pic after we nearly gobbled it up! 😅
I think their paneer starter - Paneer Tikka was one of the softest and best paneer dishes I’ve had in Hyderabad! 😍
And very sweet staff members… with good selection of background music… 🎶
And first time writing a review WITHOUT anyone requesting for it.

This is an all open sitting place with aww dropping ambience.  Beautiful lights and ample sitting.

The menu for food and beverage are different and caters to both vegetarians and non vegetarians.

The beverage menu is so unique and with so many varieties that it takes effort to decide what to have.  Everything sounds so yummy.

We ordered Berry’s Coffee Tail, Yuan Yang  and Dragon Babycorn as starter.

Berry’s coffee tail - 9/10
Babycorn - 7/10 ( too 🌶️ spicy)
Yuan Yang - 4/10.

Makobrew World Coffee Bar is simply amazing! As soon as you step inside, you’re greeted by this cozy and welcoming vibe. The place is decked out with cool decorations, and the comfy seats make it the perfect spot to enjoy a cup of seriously good coffee.

They pay attention to all the little details, like that incredible aroma of freshly ground coffee beans and how they craft each drink with care, making it feel extra special.

Now, let’s talk about the menu – there’s a bunch of different coffee options to choose from. Whether you’re a fan of strong espresso or prefer a slow-brewed pour-over, they’ve got you covered. But here’s the exciting part: they don’t just do great coffee; their selection of starters is fantastic! Seriously, so many options that pair perfectly with your favorite brew.

If you’re a coffee enthusiast, Makobrew is a must-visit – you won’t be disappointed!

The food is great and classic cold coffee I had was just next to perfect. I wish they had not added sugar as I like little less sugar other then that everything is best and staff is super quick at service. Most important its pure veg and has a ton of jain options.

This place is a pure vegetarian place that offers a wide variety of cuisines. The staffs are cordial. We ordered
• Peri peri fries
• Honey chilli lotus stem - spicy.
• Oreo shake - P.s. my friend was disappointed aa there was no oreo.
• Mac & Cheese Pastas
• Irish cold coffee
Food tastes are okayish, and it is a one-time visit place.
If one is a coffee connoisseur, then I would definitely recommend the place due to their wise variety of coffee options.

P.s. Kindly note that the road in front of the cafe is under renovation.

I attended a clay sculpting workshop here, and honestly, it was a total waste of money. The trainer was barely present or helpful, chatGPT could’ve done a better job with instructions. How can someone conduct a workshop on clay sculpting without even touching the clay?

I also had lunch here with a friend. The food was good, but it was already hot in the afternoon. The staff moved our table fan to a larger group, and we were left sharing a fan with people at the next table, who kept glaring at us like it was our fault. It was really uncomfortable.

I felt that the place is over hyped. Nothing great or extraordinary.

Taste wise most of the items were okayish.

Ordered Tomato and Manchow soup, paneer tikka, cheese balls, some 99 starter, paneer lababdar, Garlic Naan, Tandoori roti etc

Not sure of the Italian and other options.

Makobrew Cafe is a fantastic pure vegetarian, non-alcoholic spot that offers a wide variety of cuisines, including Indian. The staff are friendly and welcoming, and the cafe is very kid-friendly, making it a great place for families. Additionally, they offer valet parking, which adds to the convenience. Overall, it's a wonderful place to enjoy dinner.

This is my all time favourite cafe 🤩
I have visited it twice till now and the food and vibe are always excellent!!

✨Food is not spicy, I feel all flavours are balanced. ✨
I have only tried Veg food here till now.
