✨ Makobrew is worth the cost you spend - the food and ambience are just amazing and pleasant!!✨

This is pure vegetarian cafe I ever visited. I couldn't find non vegetarian dishes here only pure veg and that too healthy veggies options. It was so simple setup. No AC here just fans with water spray. Food tastes ok ok. Just one time visit. Prices are not worth the plate.

One of the best coffee bar. Easily recognisable from road has decent bike parking but car parking can be problematic when road is busy. Ambience of the place is too good with open air and closed space options. They have swing seats in open air and my wife enjoyed the seat. Hazel nut cold coffee was awesome and pizza was good. Overall very good experience and repeatable.

Makobrew: A Decent Dining Experience

Makobrew's ambiance is undeniably inviting, offering a pleasant setting for a casual meal. I recently visited and tried their new offering, the mozzarella carrozza, along with a classic veg pasta with Alfredo sauce.

The mozzarella carrozza was a decent addition to their menu, providing a tangy flavor that was enjoyable.
However, it didn't quite blow me away. On the other hand, their veg pasta with Alfredo sauce was a standout. The pasta was cooked to perfection, the sauce was creamy and flavorful, and the overall taste was exceptional. If I return to Makobrew, the veg pasta with Alfredo sauce will undoubtedly be my go-to choice.

Ordered italian cheese rolls, chilli cheese toast, pita bread falafel with hummus, and few other items. Food was very bland, probably the worst food I have had in past few years. Mocktails were very generic tasting with a generous dousing of mint in everything. Left most of the food at the table and commuted to a different restaurant. Waiter was constantly standing next to the table not allowing any privacy, too much service. Wouldn't recommend for dinner with friends, can consider for family.

The quality of food at Makobrew has gone to the dogs literally.We had gone for dinner  last night with our family and were highly disappointed with the kind of food served at extremely high prices which were not justified one bit.we ordered a burnt garlic soup which was full of black pepper and unnecessarily spicy burning ones tongue.the waiter recommended corn cheese falafel as a starter which was just a glorified cheese ball and nowhere near a falafel.They think customers don’t know the taste of falafel is it and are making fools of them.the main course was a Chinese sizzler in which there were no exotic vegetables at all and just two pieces of sad looking beans and 6 French fries.they served manchurian,chilly paneer and Fried rice in the sizzler which were pathetic to say the least since both the manchurian and chilly paneer were extremely sweet in taste.The worst sizzler i have eaten in my whole
Life.
My son ordered butter paneer masala along with butter naan and the vegetable was full of cream with no taste at all.Our overall bill was 2700 for the items mentioned in addition to a blue curacao drink.At this price we could have had a decent meal at other places and not end up with upset stomachs the next day.
Nice atmosphere, good sitting area, however, smoking is allowed in the premises which can be bothersome for non smokers..food is good, service is excellent..citrus mimosa(mocktail) is a highlight...

Hello dear reader, Devendra here.

I have 3 key pillars to rate a restaurant/ cafe and I am sure you would find it worthwhile to read this one.

1. Taste - This is the key part of the review. I had 5 dishes here and they were great!
a. Cheese balls - They serve you with 10 pieces of crispy mozzarella cheese balls. They are bigger than normal ones. Quantity is neither less nor more. Its 9/10 and I have taken 1 point for them using a ketchup instead of fresh tomato purée. I suggest them to try Jalapeño based sauce.
b. Crispy corn - Best tasting crispy corn I had till date. No complaints about excess oil or the corn kernels or the taste. Taste infact was MIND BLOWING.
c. Paneer Tikka Pakeezah - Best tasting paneer tikka of my life. I didn’t know paneer tikka could be this good.
d. Farm fresh Pizza - This was a bad one. I am not a fan of thin crust and hence asked for extra cheese but it was not enough. Then the base sauce of this pizza was chilli sauce and that’s disappointing from this kind of cafe.
e. Pink sauce pasta - This was amazing as well. Will give it only 9/10 because of the horrible garlic bread. It was just toasted bread with no butter or garlic. Difficult to chew.
f. Soda - They inherently dont use ice cubes and that’s something good.

2. Ambiance - Not bad. Definitely better in the night.

3. Pricing - It costed about 2600 for what I ate. I find fair considering that it was very heavy for 3 people

I visited here 1 more time after almost a year and man it still impressed me! My core non vegetarian friends were also super happy with the place and they are doing a good job!!

Located in Jubilee Hills, close to the Pedamaguddi temple, Makobrew World Coffee Bar is an easy jaunt for metro travelers. On a recent Saturday evening, I dropped by for a friend's birthday and was taken aback by the serene setting amidst the weekend hustle—surprisingly, the cafe was not packed.

A testament to thoughtful design, the ambiance exudes vibrancy. Drawing inspiration from nature, bamboo ceilings, trees lining the space, and pebble flooring coalesce into a harmonious aesthetic. The omnipresent greenery injects life into every nook, and with a sprawling seating layout, including an inviting open area and patio seating, one isn't short of choices.

Service was top-notch. The attentive, friendly, and efficient staff had us seated promptly and were accommodating to our every request, setting the tone for the culinary journey ahead.

With a large group, we sampled a diverse range: from the spicy zing of Chilli Paneer and the smoky goodness of Paneer Tikka to the crunch of lotus stem starters and water chestnuts. The Exotic Veg Pizza and Alfredo Pasta satiated our western cravings, while the Veg Fried Rice, Veg Manchuria, and Veg Noodles paid homage to Asian flavors. The Malai Broccoli was a succulent surprise, with Thai Curry warming our palates. A hot brownie rounded off the evening. Mocktails quenched our thirst with their invigorating mixes. Freshness resonated in every bite, echoing the use of handpicked ingredients.

All in all, Makobrew World Coffee Bar boasts generous portions and tick marks on all restaurant essentials. A must-visit for those seeking a blend of ambiance, service, and culinary delight.

I have been to makobrew for around 6-7 times now and NEVER have I had any complaints regarding anything here. Everything is just so perfect. The ambience , the vibe and the FOOD 😋🫶🏻

MUST TRY :
Irish cold coffee
Vanilla affogato
Paneer tikka pizza
Peri peri French fries

Food 4/5
Service 4/5
Ambience 5/5
VFM 4/5

This is a lovely place with both covered and outdoor sitting. During rains it can be slightly problematic but that has its own charm.
Food overall was good but portions were small except for the Pink Sauce pasta. We ordered Mozarella sticks, Lebanese Avocado toast, Falafel in Pita, noodles and Pink sauce pasta. Taste was all of the dishes were nice. The star of the evening certainly was the Pink sauce pasta.
Service was a bit slow with one of our dishes forgotten. Also, there was no one to seat us when we walked in, but were promptly Seated when the person became available.

Amazing food and nice ambience. Came here on a lazy Sunday for a good brunch. I suppose we came a bit early (11 AM), they didn't have the full menu available. The staff is courteous and polite.
Cheese croissant was out of the world and Cannelloni was good too. Tried Mayan Movha and Sea Salt Mocha as well which were good.
Reducing a star as the service was slow owing to a party booking. In their defense, they informed us about it and apologized.

title: The Moonshine Project / EXT
address: 385, Rd Number 82, Phase III, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India
description: Clubby hangout with concerts & comedy. Lounge-style events venue hosting live bands & stand-up comedy, plus cocktails, dining & dancing.
user_review: "Offers Live music, Good Food and ambience 🎉."

reviews_content.text: We loved this place, they have live music everyday which is the best part, the vibe was totally different with music and good food. If you are looking for telugu music I would recommend this place. The prices are reasonable and worth the quantity they are providing. The place is a bit small but it's nice and cool, even the ambience was amazing, the service was great. The music was till 11.30 and they have done a great job. Overall a great experience.

I had an amazing experience at The Moonshine Project / EXT in Jubilee Hills! The ambiance is vibrant, stylish, and perfect for a night out with friends or a relaxed evening. The music was on point, and the live performance added a fantastic touch to the overall vibe. The food was delicious—especially the appetizers—and the cocktails were well crafted and refreshing. The staff was courteous and attentive, making sure we were comfortable throughout. Whether you’re looking for great music, good food, or just a chill place to hang out, this place ticks all the boxes.

Went there for Bharat Chauhan concert. Great experience. Ambience and everything was great. You can enjoy the upper terrace DJ, grab some snacks and drinks too! It would be great if there were some sitting options, it's all booked in advance. But overall a great experience as this was my first music concert. It was very less crowded, so I had the privilege to listen to him very closely.✨

A Disastrous Experience - Would Not Recommend
From the moment we arrived, things went downhill. We were first told they don't accept online reservations, which was frustrating. Then, they insisted that they only allow couples, and when we asked to see this policy on their website, they quickly backpedaled and allowed us in. This inconsistency left a bad taste even before we sat down.
The ambience was an absolute letdown - far below what we expected. The live band was another disappointment. I had heard a lot about great live music scene at this place, but the reality was otherwise.
The only saving grace for this place is its food and courteous servers, but it was far from enough to salvage the entire experience. With such an experience, there's no chance I would recommend this place to anyone.

Sorry I'm a teetotaler so I was not able to fit in myself in this mild dark ambience, great food and even greater service. But comes with a hefty price. Maybe people who consume alco can like this place.

Simply superb - went on a weekday night . Definitely coming back again …

Service :
Was top notch , literally attentive staff , accommodating of needs & we felt like our group was always attended to .

They even charged our phone when it was about to die

Atmosphere:
The live music really brings the vibe . Went on a Telugu night - music didn’t disappoint & get the crowd grooving

Food / drinks :

When the atmosphere is electric & vibe is groovy - the food just adds to the experience . Thoroughly enjoyed all the courses . Cocktails pack a punch & definitely set the mood

The sizzler brownie at the end was the perfect cap to the night

Service and atmosphere would be a 10 on 10. Great acoustics, lively atmosphere, amazing staff. Food wise, the butter garlic prawns are a delight as my friend's say, however I prefer my nachos with black beans that is typically mexican, but otherwise great.

Special shout out to Khagen (the manager) and Feroz who waited our table for ensuring such great service.

Excellent!! Every item that we ordered are absolutely brilliant. Ambiance and service was good. So we ordered coriander fish, chicken drum sticks, chilli paneer, chicken 65 pizza, chicken Alfredo pasta, burnt garlic veg noodles. Among these items special appreciation goes to Coriander Fish, seriously i had never eaten such type of sea starter before it was superb. The remaing items were aslo excellent nothing disappointed me. Brilliant place to hang out with your friends.
I suggest everyone to visit this place and have a great day.

Thank you!!

Loved it 😍
It was my first visit and its a great experience... ambiance was great...food was not at all disappointing(had crispy corn, BBQ chicken wings, grilled fish)... lots of non-alcoholic and alcoholic options are available... with all these live perform was next level..
Raag band performed exceptionally well... loved all the songs played by them which are telugu evergreen songs.
Small place but very well organized.. service also on prompt...
Definitely must go place with families(21+).

One of my favourite spot in Hyderabad. Music - Telugu Live Bands. Giving opportunities to new upcoming bands and popular bands also will be played. Food is good. Been here so many time, never reviewed the spot.

Wednesday i been here and ordered Kodi Chips 4/5, Stuffed Mushroom 5/5(Must try), Butter Garlic Prawns 5/5, Chilli fish tikka 5/5 (Must try), Spicy Broccoli Popcorn (must try) 5/5, Badshah Murg Kebab 4/5.

All dishes tasted good. Weekdays or Weekends anytime is good to go to this place.

Heh Khagen.. Thanks for taking care of me every-time..

Loved it 😍
It was my first visit and its a great experience... ambiance was great...food was not at all disappointing lots of non-alcoholic and alcoholic options are available... with all these live perform was next level..
Ram Miriyala performed exceptionally well... loved all the songs played by them which are telugu evergreen songs.
Small place but very well organized.. service also on prompt...
Okok not bad not good I won’t suggest this place for weekdays

I had visited Moonshine by checking on Google about the nearest bar available. I was flabbergasted with the ambience and the aura of this place. It's a true unwinding place in Hyderabad.

Even though I was a stag, I was allowed inside by the bouncer.

The service was impeccable. The drinks lovely. The thin crust pizza "must try"

On top of it I got a 10% discount while paying through Zomato.

A great place to unwind to some live Telugu music band.

Overall, EXT is a top-tier pub that gets everything right, from the amenities to the service. Whether you're looking for a casual night out or a place to host a small gathering, I highly recommend giving it a try!
The seating is comfortable, with a variety of options, whether you prefer a cozy booth, a spot at the bar, or a table in their spacious outdoor area. The pub is well-ventilated, ensuring a pleasant experience no matter how packed it gets.

We chose this place for the live music and the performances were totally made it worth visiting!!
Coming to ambience - it is a cozy restro bar with limited seating. Prior reservation is necessary at least on weekends. There are very limited sitting tables. However there are a number of standing tables to enjoy the live music. There is very limited out door seating available too. There is not much to grab the attention inside when it comes to ambience. Overall an ok-ish ambience and not worth the prices but the vibe is good because of the music.

Food and drinks: the menu is quite usual and has a mix of Indian, Asian, and few italian dishes. looks like they have certain food items that go fast with the crowd.. rest of them are not available or served with minor changes. This was a little disappointing. However the taste is good. Certainly will make you go back to the plate after a bite. Crispy corn and pasta is a must try. Heads up ...There is no plain water. Only alkaline water ( a way to charge more. LoL) drinks are pricey for what this place is offering either wrt the ambience or the quantity.

Service: we had a few hiccups with the staff. They wouldn't allow people inside with casual footwear and dand for shoes even though there is no wooden floor inside which makes no sense at all. The food service is quick and the food serving staff are very friendly.
Been here on a Wednesday and though it was not too crowded but the music and the band being played was way too loud. Food was on the average side with not so trendy crowd.

It's become a hub for new and upcoming artists. There is a launch event (album/track etc.) almost every week. So, if you want to discover new artists, go take a look.
Food is average. Drinks are expensive.

Moonshine project is actually a small project 😁 in terms of seating capacity.
No issues for vehicle parking.
I visited this place with my friends on a weekend  (Wednesday) varnam band came in and gave an appealing show. Music system setup was fine. Staff were polite and were attentive most of the time.
Nothing note worthy regarding starters and overall food items. Felt Prices are very high for the food and the seating that was provided. Washrooms are neat.
Overall we had a good experience.

It had a perfect evening atmosphere with an almost care from the staff. Restrooms needs to be upgraded nevertheless they are always maintained neat.

Live music band was amazing with a mix of bollywood and tollywood songs.

Food was tasty while cocktails and mocktails were impeccable.

The Moonshine Project is a breath of fresh air in today’s fast-paced world. It stands out for its unique approach to fostering creativity and collaboration. Whether it’s through art, technology, or community-building, the project has a way of inspiring participants to think outside the box and push boundaries.
One of the most impressive aspects of The Moonshine Project is its emphasis on inclusivity. It brings together people from diverse backgrounds, encouraging them to share their perspectives and work toward a common goal. This sense of community is truly uplifting and makes the project feel like more than just an initiative—it’s a movement.
The execution of the project is also commendable. The organizers pay attention to detail, ensuring that every aspect is well thought out and impactful. Whether it’s the design, the technology, or the storytelling, everything feels intentional and purposeful.
For those who enjoy being part of something bigger than themselves, The Moonshine Project offers a rewarding experience. It’s not just about the end result but also about the journey—learning, growing, and connecting with others along the way.
If you’re looking for inspiration or a chance to make a difference, The Moonshine Project is definitely worth exploring. It’s a shining example of what can be achieved when creativity and collaboration come together.

First place to give an opportunity to the Regional bands, still going good with that!
Too crowded for an indoor sitting during these times
Food was good, just ordered for snacks and nothing disappointed us!!
We asked for an omelette which was not present on the menu and it was yum

Had an absolute banger of an experience for a perfect Saturday. Great live music, Amazing food, amazing drinks and great service! The crowd was a bit of a letdown in the later half of the night as they made things a bit uncomfy but overall it was one hell of a place!

It's a good place to hangout. Good music to keep us energetic. Food was Ok..not great but good. It's cozy and calm in weekdays. I spent my time there between 4.30pm and 6.00pm.

Ambience 8.5/10
Food 7/10
Value for money 6/10
Service 6.5/10 (this is on personal note)

Has happy hours between 12pm and 7pm. Prices are reasonable. Has outdoor seating and foosball table too.

This place is so cool and the food here tastes awesome I just loved their chilly chicken specially😋. The Band RAAG was just awesome😍. Ishaq’s voice is literally too good🥹💖. I had a great day in the moonshine project on my birthday💙.

A little bit expensive but you don't regret it. Smoking is allowed outside, so you can comfortably spend time inside. Live music. I went on Thursday with my family and the band on that day was #RaaG (Telugu). We enjoyed it a lot. You can take your kids. Food tastes good. Not many varieties but mostly you get all common starters and desserts.

One of the finest places to take your family if you're looking for live music. Please make sure the band is playing before you go

Went to this place on a weekend and it was packed. Band Capricio was playing and the vibe was amazing. The food is pretty decent and the quantity is good as well. Would absolutely recommend this for some live music and good food 🦋

That sounds really disappointing, especially when you were looking forward to a great time with your cousins. It’s frustrating when a band doesn’t meet expectations, especially if their style feels outdated. Hopefully, you’ll find a better event or band to make up for the experience! Akshar band ...very disturbed appointment

An awesome place for drinks, food and live music. You better get a reservation before you hop in. With starters and drink ..budget an average of 1200-1400 per.person..if you are planning to spend a cpl of hours.lot of vegetarian options and non alcohol drinks to choose from . Join them for live.music .

title: Parampara - Flavours Of India
address: ANR Centre, Rd Number 1, Naveen Nagar, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034, India
description: Upmarket eatery with classic dishes. Warm, brick-lined restaurant with unique wooden booths featuring traditional vegetarian cuisine.
user_review: "Tasty food and impressive ambience with live music."

reviews_content.text:
Parampara is a beautiful place to enjoy authentic Indian cuisine in Hyderabad. The ambiance is elegant and traditional, with a cultural vibe that really enhances the dining experience. The food is absolutely delicious rich flavors, great presentation, and a lot of variety in the menu. Their thalis are especially worth trying!

The only small downside was that the service was a bit slow, especially during peak hours. But the staff was courteous and the food made it worth the wait.

Perfect spot for a relaxed meal with family or friends!

I must say, their customer service is of utmost satisfactory. Especially Ms. Mounika and Mr. Shubham. They give all their attention to us and explain about every dish details. I am thankful for their patience and care.

Food is mild and tasty, their Dal tastes okay and Gulab jamun is yumm. Value for money.

The food was on point – super tasty and well-presented. Big shoutout to Monika, who took amazing care of us! She was super friendly, knew the menu well, and made the whole vibe even better.

Really loved the experience – great food, chill atmosphere, and awesome service. Can’t wait to come back (and try more from the menu)!

Glad to see another all vegetarian restaurant with huge menu and great ambience. Tried paneer 65, harabara kebab, paneer butter masala, punjabi kofta and broccoli fried rice for a late night dinner and liked only paneer 65 while every other dish was mediocre at best. Should’ve gone earlier when the chefs weren’t so tired. The live music didn’t help the overall experience either. Valet parking available!

A great experience.
Food was good, the staffs and they treat a customer is far better than any 5* hotels in India.
I really enjoyed the food and ambience.
The reason we come here is just because we are vegetarians so. I liked the food but deserts options very limited.
Panneer Tikka biriyani was good and spicy but the panneer was very large which I thought it would be nice if it was cutted into small pieces. Then corn Manchurian was good.

Had been to this new restaurant at a crowded location in the busy patta mangala street of Mayiladuthurai. Food is very good. Less spicy less masala. Vegetarians paradise. Ambience was very good. Neat and clean. Separate rest rooms available for gents and ladies. But only one. Parking is inadequate.at the max 3 cars can be parked. Similarly less food options for Sunday lunch. Only meals and variety rice. Even chappathi or parotta were not available. Mgmt can try to have other options at least during friday saturday and sunday. The captain who took the order the restaurant is open from 6 am to 11 pm. It's good.
Tasty food with lots of dishes and excellent variety too. Very cordial staff and very elegant decor. I really enjoyed good restaurant food in a long time.
Starter is amazing but for main course we are disappointed. Interior is good
Good limited buffet menu. Balanced flavour, not to rich or spicy. Good service from staff (Archana)

Quality and atmosphere is great and nice place to dine in

However, Foods are wasted here in huge quantity.
After completion of lunch requested for take away of balance food but the restaurant team has denied and am not sure what they are doing with those foods whether serve to some other table or throw it as food waste.
Needs lot of improvement in this system.
Attached the balance left over food item images.

Behaviour of staff and manger is very rude when I discuss about this issue. They are debating and using foul languages.

Prasanna is very good service giving us, awesome friendly staff. Hospitality is great. Delicious food. Each item giving us great flavours,  perfect name parampara flavours.  I recommended my friends this restaurant.  Mainly Prasanna is serving us best

Fine eating establishment with a sophisticated ambiance. There is a wide selection of vegetarian meals on the menu. They also serve traditional meals. Prices are reasonable, and the service is satisfactory. Overall, I had a positive experience and recommend it for family and friends.

It’s a strictly vegetarian restaurant serving North Indian food. Food is good but being from Delhi it was average. Tadka daal was made well while the paneer was not that soft.
I liked the tandoori mushroom.

The buffet spread was elaborate and very nice.  Poornima , Sahadev , Archana under the able guidance of Deepak took good care and served us with a smile which added to the taste , flavour and our eating experience. Keep up the good work.

Don't go on weekends it's highly crowded and it takes ages to get a place.
Buffet is not worth the amount you pay..
You get one soup and one welcome drink..4 starters were served at the table out of 4, 2 (mushroom and fruits) were good. Main course was strictly average,so were desserts.
Best part was their service..service staff were good..
Restaurant looks old with average maintenance..

'Parampara - Flavours Of India' , the name itself speaks about a tradition. Good food & Ambiance. Recommend to go with family especially parents who are pure veg will like this

A good restaurant for family to celebrate 🥳.

(And I added parampara menu here)

MENU(So much variety and affordable price)

Soup
Desserts
Ice Creams
Beverages
Tandori Kebabs
Indian Breads
Indian Rice
Indian Main Course
Chinese Starters

Food was really tasty and highly recommended for vegetarian lovers. Only one small thing they need to improve the service time while delivering the food while eating. We ordered veg north indian thali it was great.

The food quality and taste were exceptional. Every bite was a delightful experience, full of flavor and freshness. The ingredients were clearly top-notch, and each dish was made with great care. From the starters to the desserts, everything was well-balanced and beautifully presented. It was a meal to remember, making me want to come back for more.

An amazing cosy place to hangout with family, friends and colleagues. Ambience is amazing with good food and heaven for vegetarians but I’ve visited on weekend so too much of rush and waiting time. We have tried their platter, spring rolls and Potli biryani - quantity is really good but costly also.

I recently dined here, and my experience was a mixed bag. While there were some positive aspects, there were also areas that fell short of expectations.

Starting with the positives, the ambiance of the restaurant is quite pleasing. The decor is stylish, and the atmosphere is inviting, making it a good spot for a casual dinner or a date night. Additionally, the attendants were well-behaved and polite, providing good service throughout our meal.

However, there were a few significant drawbacks that detracted from the overall experience. Firstly, the space is not well-suited for larger groups. We were a party of ten, and the seating arrangement was quite cramped and uncomfortable. It's clear that the restaurant is better suited for smaller groups.

Regarding the food, I found it to be average at best, especially considering the price point. Some dishes, in particular, did not live up to the standard one would expect from a restaurant of this caliber.

In summary, while Parampara has a pleasant ambiance and courteous staff, the food quality and seating arrangements for larger groups leave much to be desired. If you're planning a visit, it might be best to go with a smaller group and manage your expectations regarding the food.

Located right on main road and has ample parking in basement with valet option available.
We went on Saturday night and waiting period was close to 35min for table of 8. The sitting is limited so expect some waiting time specially on weekend.
However they make up the time with quick service and good food. Ambience is nice with nicely lit of lights and paintings. Occasionally they also have live music with Indian retro songs. Taste is good and highly recommended for families looking for veg dining.

I am recently visited at parampara and I am very happy with food and the service.also the ambiance also so nice.the food taste was next level 😘 and the service was top notch☺️.and specially the lady archana was too good. Thank you parampara ♥️♥️♥️

"I had an amazing dining experience at Parampara! The food was delicious, and the service was top-notch. I'd like to extend a special thank you to Abhishek and Jannat for their exceptional hospitality and attention to detail. They made sure our meal was nothing short of perfect. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great meal and wonderful service!" 5/5 stars!

Terrible Service and Lack of Transparency – Not Worth the Price!

I visited Parampara Restaurant expecting a decent buffet experience, but it turned out to be a complete disappointment. We were charged a whooping ₹650 per person, and yet the service was absolutely subpar.

1. No Communication, No Transparency
– Nowhere was it mentioned that rotis, naan, or chapatis were available as part of the buffet. No staff informed us, no signage, nothing!
– When we inquired about it while paying the bill, we were shocked to hear that they expect customers to ask! Since when do diners have to guess what’s included in a buffet?

2. Horrible Service and Indifference
– The staff showed zero effort in guiding or assisting guests.
– Instead of making the dining experience smooth, they seemed careless and unwilling to engage with customers.

3. Overpriced for the Experience Provided
– If you’re charging ₹650 per person, at least ensure basic service and transparency.
– Not informing about core food items feels like a scam—they hope you don’t ask, so they can save on costs.

4. Final Verdict
– If you value good service and honesty in dining, avoid this place.
– The management needs to seriously rethink their customer experience instead of trying to make money through deception.

Would I go back? Absolutely NOT.
The service was Fantastic. The staff Lomi and Manohar were very helpful with the menu. The atmosphere was impeccable. Would recommend and visit again.

Been here quite a few times. Most of the items are delectable and equally food service.

Items must try:
Paneer Rogan Josh
Mix veg curry
Malai roti
Butter naans
Singapore fried rice (must try)
Rasmalai
Methi Malai kofta

title: Mud brick kitchen and bar
address: 724a, Road No. 36, CBI Colony, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033, India
user_review: "The food was very fabulous along with live music band"

reviews_content.text: This very Worst Mud brick kitchen and bar I have seen ever. There is no proper sitting arrangement and no good main course, it's very horrible and staff behaviour is not even they are not asking totally ignoring... would suggest Don't come to this place, ( come on your own risk).. I have shared the pics also for reference. Very very bad experience this 😡😡.

We went on a Monday to find out that Happy hours are on...The Whole evening on Monday and Tuesday . The happy hour menu is 179 for every item...drinks as well as food. Each drink has 30ml of alcohol and the food portion is half of regular portions. For the price, it's a great deal. We ordered almost 15 dishes and everything tasted really good. The cocktails were nice too. The service was alright. It might be slow if it's a busy night.
The place has a huge courtyard and two floors with open air seating. There is a small enclosed AC area on the group floor. The only issue we had was mosquitoes.
I would recommend Happy Hours as on other days, the prices are way high.

Last evening I visited this place and let me start by telling you about the ambiance.
They have both outdoor and indoor seating, I personally loved the outdoor seating, it's very breezy and beautiful. It's perfectly qualifies for a very classy cafe, would surely recommend for dates. In the evening they have live music too, which adds to the ambiance.
Coming to the food, some of the items taste really great while others are passably okay.

This is a perfect place to watch a match and enjoy the outside seating. They also have a live music band that plays which you can enjoy. They have a wide range of starters and drinks that are perfect for an evening out. They have a huge pizza which is soft with a thin base and delicious. Their cheesecake is also something that I really liked with a balance of flavors. Definitely visit this place.

Ambience was good ,food was yummy and most importantly service was super quick but it was really strange experience by 11:55 staff started asking us to leave , worst was they didn't even allow us to take ONE group pic. They literally forced us to leave and they were blaming police but it was babdly raining so we were in bay just for the shelter but still they made stand in rain 🌧️☔

Open only in the evenings it a must go place recommended for everyone. It's a kids friendly Restaurant with live music and karaoke. One of the best thing about this place is the Ambience which also makes it suitable for not just evening outings but also candlelight dinners. With an amazing menu appetizing starters and loaded main course and sweetening desserts with prompt service and courteous staff they never fail to impress.

The ambience was pretty cool and stylish, but the problem persists with the food. The food was served pretty cold.

The starters, maggi cheese balls were below average and served cold, veg manchuria was hot but the there was no proper binding and it was breaking when we tried to eat it.

The only best thing was the Alfredo pasta it was hot, creamy and spicy with the garlic bread. When  lasagna was ordered, I was thinking it would be with lasagna sheets, but it turned out to be something else. It was over creamy and the sticks were very oily too.

Overall it was a disappointing experience being here after hearing a lot positive reviews.

For more food updates, follow me on insta Theappetizingfactor

Visited this place on a weekday, sharing the same complex as Carpe Diem, I really loved the setup.

Ample amount of art work on the walls and the big sign welcomes you into it. There are several sitting options, indoor, outdoor, and there's couple seating option too in the 1st floor, a bit away from the crowd.

Oh, and there's live music too, loved that.

Coming to the food, we ordered a bunch of mocktails & cocktails. The cocktails were great, ordered a favourite of mine- the screwdriver, which was made perfectly.

About the starters, firstly the presentation is great. Specially loved the tandoori prawns & fish ones, those definitely were my favourites.

Chicken bruschetta - This was a heavy dish as usual, and tasted great.

Loaded veg nachos - I found it not too appetizing for my taste.

Tiranga paneer - This basically had 3 different types of paneer in it.

Burmese parcel

Mutton galouti kebab - must have

Garlic pizza- This had such a strong aroma of garlic from it, loved it to bits.

Both the pizzas: Mexican pizza & Smokey chicken pizza had very thin crust, and the toppings were great too.

Ordered one Chicken burger, the presentation was great, tasted average.

In desserts:

Homemade churros

Icecream with brownie

The service was fast, and being a weekday it wasn't too crowded too. The starters were amazing. A great place to chill in the busy street of jubilee hills

The place is good and the ambience is nice.
The food is tasty and the music played here is soothing.
I was in total surprise when vocals started to play in here. There were two guys who played guitar and started singing.
It was tooooo goodd!!!
Would love to go to this place again.
Seating is also well planned.

Last night I visited this place and let me start by telling you about the ambiance.
They have both outdoor and indoor seating, I personally loved the outdoor seating, it's very breezy and beautiful. It's perfectly qualifies for a very classy cafe, would surely recommend for dates. In the evening they have live music too, which adds to the ambiance.
Coming to the food, some of the items taste really great while others are passably okay.

I would absolutely recommend their starters, especially Bruschettas and in their desserts the Karachi Biscuit cheesecake is a must try.
Their service is quick and responsive.
If you're in Jubilee Hills looking for a place to go for a date, this place would be one of my recommendations.

A excellent restro bar in the same premises of the well known night club of the city-carpedium is ‘The Mudbricks‘.
Located in the prime location of Jubilee Hills,this is a convenient cafe for everyone to visit. This nice looking ,out of the way cafe in Hyderabad  is a perfect chill out place for a group of friends or family .Having both indoor and outdoor seating with a well stocked up bar counter ,this beautiful one is go to place this winters in these breezy afternoons.With its comfortable seating and pleasant decor this cafe gives you good vibes as soon as you enter. The staff at this place are friendly and courteous. I’ve been to this place on the first day of the year for lunch with a group of foodie friends of mine.The cafe was full and we hardly found a place. In spite of too many orders, the service was prompt and appreciable.

Food:

Kali mirch daal Palak shorba :
A perfect one for this winter weather. With a proper consistency and spiced up flavour this soup was just amazing.The black pepper flavour was noticeable and was perfectly blended with the other two ingredients of the soup.
This is a must try at this place!

Loaded nachos :
Nothing can be more satisfying than a tray loaded with nachos with lots and lots of cheese topping.This perfect munching dish looked colourful and was a perfect one to go with drinks.

Burmese parcels :
A pack of flavour,these indeed are a must try at this place. With a crispy rectangular pocket pack filled with flavourful corn and veggies stuffing is a  creative and delicious dish at this place.

Zatar cheese bruschetta :
Bruschettas are always love!
It had a perfect base of crispy garlic bread topped with fresh,tasty and creamy cheese.It is a must try appetiser at this place.

Smoked chicken salad :
This salad was presented in a colourful way which was a eye candy to us.It was deliciously blended,refreshing and a simple salad. Must try !

Nawabi murgh tikka :
This was a mouth watering dish and was delicious in taste. The chicken was tender , juicy and had a blast of flavours as soon as you take a bite of it .
Must try !

Maggi cheese balls :
The Maggie cheese balls,the crispy outer later of Maggi and cheese on the inner aspect.These balls were really delicious.A new and innovative dish to try at this place.

Stuffed mushroom :
This starter was incredibly tasty and had good stuffing inside the mushrooms.
The mushroom was soft,tender and juicy.
This is a must try at this place.

Deserts:
Karachi biscuits baked cheese cake & Chocolate drunkers
Perfect place and perfect deserts,that is what I’ve to tell about deserts.
These both are the best and amazing ones at this place .

Do visit this amazing place !

It was a fabulous experience. The taste of food was yummilicious😋.

SHOULD TRY WOOD FIRE BAKED FISH! You won't regret this order for sure.

Jubliee hills has got all required, resturants, pubs, clubs, etc.
One of the jewel of Jubliee hills is Mudbrick.
In the vicinity of Carpe diem club, this place has a bar and kitchen.
Open roof, live music and a huge pheonix on the wall. This place has it all, from polite and humble staff to lip smacking food.
Was here on a weekday evening, and this place had good crowd.
The Mudbrick kitchen and bar is divided into four sections. One is right next to the Pheonix and the band stage, next to it is the live earth oven kitchen where pizzas are made. The second section is enclosed with 5-6 tables inside and beautiful Graffiti on the wall with some dream catchers.
There are two roof top sections, one on the left is dedicated to romantic candle light dinners and one on the right has huge lounging space.
The area is well knit for all kind of occasions.
Coming to food and drinks, started with a couple of mocktails and cocktails.
I don't wanna be specific with the name of the drinks because everything on the menu is superb. You can order and try it for yourself.
But among the cocktails, i personally love the Pinacolada and chilli guava.
Started with some prawns Tom Yum soup, it was decent, could have been a little better.
Mudbrick usually have soup of the day options, which changes every other day.
The highly recommended starters here are the Burmese parcel and Bharwan Kumbh. These two are the most delishhhh and should definitely be tried.
Also tried peri peri prawns, jalapeno poppers, thai basil chilly paneer. One more a must try starter is Afghani Murg tikka, the blend of spices and the smoky flavour to the kebab, is just scrumptious.
Tangdi kebabs are also decent.
Lamb chops are also served here. The spices and marination part of the chops were perfect except for the meat, was a little chewy, could have been cooked more.
AOP chicken is one of the speciality here, highly recommended.
Also tried the mexican brickwood oven pizza. For the Main course had the chicken tikka biryani. To my surprise it was one of the best Biryanis I have had.
Totally recommend it when you visit here.
In desserts had the chocolate brownie with vanilla icecream.
Overall the food and service of this place is on point 💯
The ambience and vibe gives you a good time here.
Highly recommended.
Happy eating 😊😊😊

A part of Carpediem night club, Mudbrick Kitchen is a nice open restaurant that has a separate private dining area and stages soothing live performances. The exterior is dimly lit, creating a cosy ambiance. The private dining is decorated with Mandala art on the back wall and bright warm lighting. The menu offers a variety of Continental and European food, paired with a cool bar menu. It's a nice place to have your dinner at.

A part of Carpediem night club, Mudbrick Kitchen is a nice open restaurant that has a separate private dining area and stages soothing live performances. Rupesh Rana was performing when I had visited this place for a weekend dinner, and me and my friends had a nice time.

The exterior is dimly lit, creating a cosy ambiance. The private dining is where we sat, it is decorated with Mandala art on the back wall and bright warm lighting. I liked the minimalist style of the interiors.

We started off with some of their appetizing soups; Roasted Tomato & Bell Pepper Cappuccino, Ala Funghi Tea Set and Chicken Thai Tom Yum Soup. All of these were, but I specially liked the Ala Funghi Tea set. It was quite unique and tasted great.

Next from the starters, we had Smoked Chicken Bruschetta, which was quite good, Patthar ka Gosht was absolutely perfect and delicious, Kalmi Kebab and Mutton Galouti Kebab were fine and Peri Peri Prawns which seemed slightly undercooked.

Then we had the non-veg Platter, which had a variety of grilled items including Patthar ka Gosht and other various kebabs and fish as well. They were all very good. We also had Tarquito, fried tortilla cones filled with beans, jalapeno, tomato salsa and avocado ice cream, which was one of their special dishes. It was very refreshing.

Before moving onto the main course, we had a few mocktails namely, Mangorita, Safe Sex on the Beach, Virgin Mojito and Fall Alert. Mangorita was very mangoey, Safe sex was cranberry and grape fruit juices and it was very fresh. Rest were fine.

From the main course we ordered Chicken Tikka Pizza, Chicken Alfredo Pasta in white sauce and Chicken Spaghetti in mix sauce. Pizza wasn't that great. The toppings were fine but the base wasn't satisfactory. Both the pastas though were really good, they made up for the pizza in the entree.

Lastly in desserts, we had Homemade Churros, Chocolate Dunkers and Creme Brulee. All were good, but Creme Brulee was the best. Just fabulous! It was the perfect dessert.

Re-open time for all the business with Covid taking a back seat, because life has to go on.. Mudbrick too is back with a bang, taking all the necessary safety measures and also with a great menu! The red glowing phoneix gives the rooftop place a magnificent look. The food and drinks served were all upto the mark. We had a range of mocktails served.. the food was fabulous.. starting from the potato leaks soup, white creamy chicken soup.. there were an amazing show of starters and we were fortunate enough to taste those delicacies in one go.. lemongrass chicken, peri peri wings, texi mexi chicken, veg chimmi chinga, moyal fish, tandoori shashlik.. even the main course including biriyani, paneer, kulcha, naan. Everything tasted just perfect. They have a place for Live music as well.. overall a great place to hangout as we step into post Covid period.

MudBrick has a beautiful ambiance, and is super spacious too. If you want to have a good meal, we'd probably suggest you skip the starters and directly jump to the main course. They've got a couple of delicious Indian Main course dishes, like Dal Makhni, Rajma, Tasks Dal, along with some rice and breads. Quite liked their Dal Makhni, it was creamy and had a well balance of flavors. Next, there are some absolutely delicious desserts like the Baked Cheesecake and Churros. We totally loved the baked cheesecake. It had a good texture and was just the right amount of sweet. It was served along with melted Strawberry ice cream, and they complimented each other really well.
The starters were quite disappointing, being quite bland in flavors. Their mocktails weren't that good either, except for their Virgin Mojito.
If you're an alcohol lover, you would want to try this place because it gives Happy Hours from 12pm to 7pm.

Recently been to Mud brick at Jubilee hills, its lovely place to hang out with friends and family. They have indoor as well as outdoor sitting space. You will definitely like the Ambience, as it gives you a pleasant feeling. They have mini stage for live performances and they also have big projector screening .

Coming to food they have huge list of varieties in their menu like Chicken, Fish, Lamb, Mutton, Prawns ,Veg which will definitely satisfy your taste buds.

Started with salad - Avocado salad

Starters - Crackling prawns,Pahadi fish,Kalmi kebab,Lamb texmex ,Burmese parcel,Maggi cheese balls ,Lamb chops,Chicken tactic wings ,Cottage cheese tapinut with paprika sauce

Pizza - Chimichori pizza, Fapulo pizza

Main course - Diwali pander curry (Veg)
Acharichicken curry ( Non-Veg)

They serve delicious Mocktail's.

Ended with a delicious dessert,
-Molten Chocolate.

Overall it was an Amazing experience. Do visit and experience urself 😃

The Cafe is now opened serving delicious food and taking utmost precautions ✅
Very good place... since, there was a live band, could take my children and the food tasted awesome! Drinks were excellent 👍... what more to ask. Go and enjoy with ur family and friends.

The music is too loud and the waiters are too rude to take requests. Dnt go even if you want to try new place. It just ruined the mood. They take almost 45 mins to serve food . Very bad experience. The staff is very rude and this is the first restaurant I m giving very bad review. Just go for another place.

Had visited Mudpipe on 1st of January and I really had an amazing experience here.
I was invited for a session at Mudpipe and the staff was friendly and pro-active. The management here is also amazing.
This place is spread on a huge area and it has comfortable seating arrangements.
The mocktails and cocktails here are amazing and all of them has a perfect blend of flavors.

In starters I had ,
1. Cheesey Bruschetta- As the name suggest , it's a cheesy starter.
2. Veg loaded Nachos - This was good in taste.
3. Burmese Parcels - This is the best starter I had here. Filled with cheese and vegetables inside , it was amazing in taste.
4. Maggi cheese balls - Definitely ny favorites here.
5. Veg Burger - This was one the best burgers I had in the city. Definitely a must try .

For the main course , I had dal tadka and dal makhani with rice and it was heaven. The main was really amazing and delicious.

The desserts here are a must try especially the strawberry cheesecake.

Overall , an amazing experience and would love to visit this place again. Cheers !

Atmosphere is good one can visit but I didn't think that the atmosphere was very good for party people because less people come here you can come for a date since less people are there music is good and 2 seating options are there down and up food is Okey they have good options in veg and non veg I found starters to be good.

This New year was at Mudbrick for lunch. They have both indoor and outdoor door seating arrangements with wooden decor & phoenix symbol. It's very spacious and is located at same place as Carpe Diem

The Mocktials are very good. The virgin mojito was my favorite when it comes to starters cheese garlic bread has generous amount of cheese & herbs.
Maggi Cheese Balls fried Maggi noodles stuffed with cheese & mixed herbs with relishing flavours and appealing texture.

In the main course Alfredo pasta was rich & creamy with fresh veggies. Jeera rice and Yellow dal tadka are absolutely tasty. The rice had good amount of jeera.

When it comes to dessert Karachi biscuit cheesecake was delicious in taste with strawberry sauce made from one of the famous Karachi bakery biscuits.Chocolate drunkers - A crispy fillo pastry filled with chocolate bar severed with strawberry & Chocolate sauce was yummy

A wonderful property situated in Jubilee Hills that shares the same premises as Carpediem. MudBrick Kitchen and Bar has an open air seating under the black blue sky with the stars twinkling all over the sky, the bright moon light and some good live music making your dinner more beautiful and romantic provided you are with your girlfriend or Wife . The Restaurant can be visited with family also . Just in case it rains the restaurant has made arrangements for some indoor seating as well with bright lights not to dissapoint their guests and you also have an option for a candle light dinner during the weekends ! We bloggers visited the MudBrick Kitchen and Bar for a session and this started of with some drinks such as the Shangria , Virgin Mojito , silver lining and the Meerut ki Jaan ! The drinks made the summer evening better and then the starters kept coming and were spread all over the table ! My favourite and even the non vegetarians loved this starter named burmese parcels . It was Crisp and tasty and makes you crave for more .An item that you have to ask for even before you look at the menu . The other starters that we got our hands on were the lotus steam and the water chest nut . This particular item can be not liked by everyone as it is not regular starters that you find everywhere . It is filled in some tangy sauce and I also got a chance to taste the maggie cheese balls that were droll worthy ! This item was filled with a lot of cheese inside covered with crispy Maggie fried and also the loaded nachos . As we were about to order the main course the chef gave us a surprise with a nitrogen pan . Betel leaves with vanilla icecream inside ! We were all excited when we saw the item and tasted it . We also ordered a Mexican pizza and it was indeed very good. The pizza was topped with mozzarella cheese and some exotic Vegetables. As a Vegetarian I settled for a fried rice for main course with some garlic sauce . The evening became sweeter when we got a chance to taste the chocolate drunkers . Chocolate bars filled with fillo pastry and not to forget the service , it was fantastic . The crew made a lot of effort to make the evening much better by serving us scrumptious dishes !

It's and exceptional place for a romantic ni8, the open space and breeze around gives you the perfect spot. The beauty lies within the tree placed in the centre of mudbrick. The food is pretty awesome and has that moderate prices.

Food at this place is pretty bad. We ordered Tandoori Khumb, which tasted sweet and the filling tasted funny. It came out pretty cold. Then we ordered Jalapeno balls, there was no Jalapeno. Pretty cold. We ordered crisps and dips platter. Cold pieces of Garlic nan,cold Nachos and some french fries. Dips served in small disposable cups. Hummus, salsa and mayo. Very little quantity. We ordered Pasta in Arabiatta sauce, which was just ok. Nothing great. For the price they charge, food is very ordinary. Service was prompt.

The place had good vibe but the service is genuinely bad. We waited for an hour to get a water bottle. We went there in the evening, the mosquitoes were just all over the place(in the open space, obviously) The food was nice tho. We order non veg platter & veg pulao, they tasted surprisingly good. Sorry for the blurry pictures.

If you ignore the crowd from Carpe Diem, it was a nice place. Food was good. Drinks - I took Pina Coladas, it was a bit expensive and quantity was little less for the price but was overall good experience. The band was good too 😊

Food was average....
Service would have been better, ordered item takes nearly 30mins even when the restaurant was nearly empty.
Ambience is good. Needs a little more lighting on the top floor
